fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
ACCOUNT NOTES - Mid-Market Pipeline Review Meeting

Meeting Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025

Note: This conversation is an internal Thatch sales team pipeline review meeting, not a conversation with a specific employer about ICHRA for 2026 renewals. The meeting covers multiple client accounts and operational challenges.

KEY DISCUSSION POINTS

1. Enrollment Performance (12/15 Deadline)
- Strong Performance: Mid-market groups exceeded expectations, with over 300k ARR booked on 12/15 alone
- Notable Successes:
  - Metasource: Grew from 60 to 260 enrolled
  - Napalm: Reached ~1,200 enrolled (from 600)
  - Elko: Achieved over 100% of expected enrollment
  - Lund Stoller: 177 enrolled vs. 140 expected

2. Critical Medicare Workflow Challenges
- Major Gap Identified: Current Medicare enrollment process is insufficient for the Medicare-eligible population
- Key Issues:
  - Tech literacy barriers for 65+ population
  - Lack of phone support (population prefers calling vs. online forms)
  - Confusion about Medicare Parts A & B enrollment requirements
  - Timing challenges with Medicare advisor availability
- Broker Feedback: Multiple brokers requesting dedicated phone number for Medicare support

3. Sales Cycle Education Needs
- Gap: Medicare requirements not adequately communicated during sales process
- Impact: Clients surprised that Medicare-eligible employees MUST transition to Medicare under ICHRA (not optional)

STAKEHOLDERS & RESPONSIBILITIES

Internal Team (Thatch)
- Zach Egan: Team Lead, coordinating pipeline and process improvements
- Kara Kubarych: CS/Implementation oversight, tracking enrollment metrics
- Retsy Holliday: AE managing Lund Stoller, Elko, Sphinx, KMC, Wraps, Home Life
- Denis Kalamar: AE managing 3G, LFC
- Tom Hemmingsen: AE managing Belonging Medical Group
- Kaitlin Zidar: AE discussing land-and-expand strategy
- Andrew Solomon: Team member, technical support
- Julia Korzeniowski: Operations/gifting coordination
- Jeremy: Medicare specialist providing advisor support
- Gary: Leadership requesting updated forecasts

External Partners
- Brokers: Andy (Lund Stoller - high anxiety, needs handholding), Casey & Chris (USI - Home Life deal)
- Paychex: Partner on Wraps opportunity

ACTIVE OPPORTUNITIES (2/1/2026 START DATES)

High Priority Deals

1. Lund Stoller (Retsy)
- Status: 177 enrolled (127% of expected)
- Challenge: Medicare support for 95-year-old owner (Len Stoller) and 68-year-old son (Barry)
- Broker Issue: Andy realized late that Len Stoller needs Medicare setup
- Action: Jeremy's calendar link provided to broker for Medicare consultation

2. Home Life - USI Referral (Retsy)
- Status: Highest likelihood to close
- Activity: Decision-maker actively reviewing quotes over weekend, asking detailed questions
- Broker: USI team (Casey & Chris) fully advocating
- Next Step: Gift box being sent to USI team via Chad

3. Wraps (Retsy)
- Size: 85 Medicare-eligible employees (owner estimates only ~10 will enroll)
- Concern: Medicare workflow capacity
- Status: Competitive quote despite older population (avg age 59)
- Timeline: Decision needed by end of week/early next week for successful 2/1 launch
- Partner: Paychex rep back-channeled for urgency

4. KMC (Lazy Boy Split-Off) (Retsy)
- Size: 210 employees, 108-110 expected enrolled
- Challenge: Quote $200-300k higher than expected (but competitive with group market)
- Status: Presented 12/12, evaluating carve-out options for hourly/part-time/incentive-based sellers
- Context: New business formation, no current benefits (virgin group from Lazy Boy perspective)

5. Tiro (Retsy)
- Status: Due diligence stage
- Pricing: $20 PEPM (matched venture pricing), no broker
- Challenge: Decision velocity - founders not moving fast enough
- Strategy: Offering 2025 pricing to incentivize 2/1 close vs. mid-year
- Context: Not currently offering benefits, want to attract/retain talent

LATER START DATE OPPORTUNITIES

LFC (Denis) - 3/1/2026 Target
- Next Meeting: Mid-January 2026
- Challenge: 25 Medicare-eligible employees in New York
- Status: Not realistic for 2/1 due to timeline and self-funded complexity
- Note: Moved from 2/1 to 3/1 pipeline

L.J. Rogers (Retsy) - 4/1/2026 Target
- Size: 210 employees, 108 enrolled
- Industry: Trucking company, North Carolina
- Status: Strong interest after employee disruption analysis with Caitlin
- Strategy: Offering 2025 pricing if contract signed by 2/1/2026
- Activity: Danielle scheduling follow-up meeting this week/early next week

Edgewood Companies (Denis) - Mid-Year Potential
- Location: Tahoe, El Dorado, Nevada area
- Blocker: Waiting for Providence network expansion
- Status: Not proposing until network updates available in quoting tool
- Timeline: Corey to confirm Providence network availability by 2/1

CRITICAL MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

December 12, 2024: KMC quote presented (multiple variations: dynamic MAC, flat cost, carve-out options)

December 15, 2024 (Original Deadline):
- Major enrollment push resulted in 300k+ ARR booked
- Multiple groups significantly exceeded expected enrollment

December 16, 2024 (This Meeting):
- Pipeline review conducted
- Medicare workflow gaps formally identified as business-critical issue

December 19, 2024 (Extended Deadline):
- Final deadline for 12/15 cohort groups
- Minimal additional movement expected

Week of December 16, 2024:
- Wraps decision needed
- Home Life decision expected
- L.J. Rogers follow-up meeting scheduled
- Tiro check-in planned

January 2026:
- Medicare support documentation to be finalized (one-pager for sales cycle)
- Medicare workflow training planned for sales team
- LFC meeting scheduled mid-month

February 1, 2026:
- Fiscal year end for bookings purposes
- Target close date for active 2/1 opportunities
- Contract deadline for L.J. Rogers to receive 2025 pricing

PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS IDENTIFIED

Medicare Support Enhancements (Priority)
1. Phone Number: Top priority for Gary - timeline TBD but critical for 2026
2. Sales Cycle Documentation: One-pager being developed for every sales cycle (early January 2026)
3. Team Training: Medicare team (Lauren, Jeremy, Hillary) to lead training in early January
4. Support Page: Updated FAQ page available (shared by Kara)
5. Clarification Needed: Parts A & B enrollment support scope vs. Part D/supplementals

Quoting Tool Updates
- Providence Network Expansion: Denis requesting timeline confirmation from Corey for Tahoe/El Dorado/Nevada areas
- Expected Enrollment Field: Not auto-populating from Salesforce; manual entry required

Sales Process
- Expected Enrollment Tracking: Critical metric for CS team to assess performance vs. assumptions
- Land-and-Expand Strategy: Discussion of potential Account Management team for renewals/upsells (future state)

NEXT STEPS & DEADLINES

Immediate (This Week - December 16-20, 2024)

Retsy Holliday:
- [ ] Check in with Tiro (Michael) - discuss 2025 pricing incentive for 2/1 close
- [ ] Follow up with KMC on quote evaluation and carve-out decisions
- [ ] Confirm Wraps decision timeline with Paychex rep
- [ ] Check in with Home Life on decision status
- [ ] Monitor L.J. Rogers meeting with Danielle

Zach Egan:
- [ ] Consult with Jeremy on Medicare requirements/questions for Wraps (85 Medicare-eligible)
- [ ] Confirm Providence network timeline with Corey for Denis's opportunities
- [ ] Coordinate Medicare one-pager development with Medicare team

Chad Schneider:
- [ ] Send gift box to USI team (Casey & Chris) for Home Life deal

Denis Kalamar:
- [ ] Follow up on Providence network expansion availability in quoting tool

Short-Term (By End of December 2024)
- [ ] Finalize any remaining 12/19 extended deadline enrollments
- [ ] Update Salesforce expected enrollment fields for remaining gaps

January 2026
- [ ] Medicare team training for sales team (early month)
- [ ] Distribute Medicare one-pager for sales cycle use
- [ ] LFC meeting scheduled mid-month
- [ ] L.J. Rogers contract target (for 2025 pricing eligibility)

Strategic Priorities
- [ ] Implement phone support for Medicare population (Gary's top priority - timeline TBD)
- [ ] Develop Account Management structure for renewals/upsells (future state)
- [ ] Improve Medicare education in sales cycle to set proper expectations

ADDITIONAL NOTES

Pricing Flexibility: Team authorized to discount to lowest possible PEPM for 2/1 closes vs. later start dates

Bookings vs. Enrollment: Q1 2026 focus on both enrolled lives AND bookings (contracts signed) for investor/board reporting

Team Performance: Strong collaboration noted between AEs, implementation managers, and broker partners throughout 12/15 push

System Issues: Some Salesforce fields not auto-populating; manual updates required for accurate reporting

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__ed.value:
The conversation provides limited information about how most prospects currently administer employee benefits:

Home Life: Works with USI as their broker. The sales team mentions having "a great relationship with Casey and Chris" (USI brokers) who are "advocating for us" and engaged in co-selling.

Tiro: Currently does not offer benefits to employees, so no benefits administration system is in place.

KMC: This is a split-off from Lazy Boy creating a new business entity. They are transitioning from Lazy Boy's system but specific details about their current or previous benefits administration platform are not discussed.

For the remaining prospects mentioned in the conversation (Wraps, LFC, L.J. Rogers, Lund Stoller, Edgewood Companies), how they currently administer employee benefits is not discussed. The conversation focuses primarily on enrollment numbers, Medicare challenges, pricing discussions, and pipeline management rather than the prospects' existing benefits administration tools, workflows, or platforms.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
IMPORTANT NOTE: This conversation is an internal Thatch sales team pipeline review meeting held on December 16, 2025, not a conversation with a prospect/customer about ICHRA interest. The question template does not match the conversation content.

ACCOUNT NOTES - MM Pipeline Review Meeting

Meeting Overview
Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025  
Meeting Type: Internal Mid-Market Pipeline Review  
Participants: Zach Egan (Sales Lead), Retsy Holliday, Kara Kubarych, Andrew Solomon, Denis Kalamar, Tom Hemmingsen, Kaitlin Zidar, Patricia Gorla, Donny Ho, Julia Korzeniowski, Chad Schneider

KEY DISCUSSION POINTS

1. Medicare Enrollment Challenges (Critical Issue)
- Len Stoller Group: Successfully exceeded enrollment expectations (177 enrolled vs 140 expected), but facing significant Medicare workflow issues
- Problem Identified: 95-year-old owner (Len Stoller) and 68-year-old son (Barry) need Medicare support; broker (Andy) is high-anxiety and requires extensive handholding
- Systemic Gap: Current Medicare workflow is insufficient for the Medicare-eligible population (tech-challenged users struggle with online enrollment)
- Key Feedback: Multiple brokers requesting a phone number for Medicare population; online forms and scheduling are overwhelming for this demographic

2. Enrollment Performance (12/15 Mid-Market Groups)
- Over $300K in ARR booked from enrolled members on December 15, 2025
- Notable successes:
  - Metasource: 60 → 260 enrolled
  - Napalm: 600 → ~1200 enrolled
  - Elko: Over 100% of expected enrollment
- Deadline extended to December 19, 2025 for final enrollment push

3. Active 2-1 (February 1, 2026) Pipeline Opportunities

TIRO (Due Diligence Stage)
- Size: Not offering benefits currently
- Contact: Michael (co-founder met in Amsterdam)
- Status: Decision-making delayed; strategically interested in offering benefits for talent retention
- Pricing: Already at $20 PEPM (matched venture PEPM), no broker
- Action: Willing to discount further to secure 2-1 start date

KMC (Lazy Boy Split-Off)
- Size: Significant group with hourly, part-time, and incentive-based sellers
- Challenge: Quote is $200K-$300K higher than expected (but competitive with group quotes)
- Status: Presented quote December 12, 2025; evaluating carve-out options
- Decision Timeline: Expected this week

RAPS
- Size: 85 Medicare-eligible employees (average age 59 years)
- Critical Note: Owner estimates only ~10 of 85 would actually enroll
- Status: Very interested; competitive quote despite older population
- Concern: Medicare experience workflow
- Decision Deadline: End of week/early next week for successful 2-1

Home Life (USI Referral)
- Status: Highest likelihood of the three 2-1 opportunities
- Broker: USI team (Casey and Chris) fully engaged and advocating
- Activity: Decision-maker actively reviewing SBCs and quotes over weekend
- Decision Timeline: End of week target

STAKEHOLDERS & RESPONSIBILITIES

Internal Thatch Team:
- Zach Egan: Sales Lead, managing pipeline and strategic decisions
- Retsy Holliday: AE managing Len Stoller, Tiro, KMC, RAPS, Home Life, L.J. Rogers
- Kara Kubarych: CS Lead, monitoring enrollment performance and Medicare issues
- Denis Kalamar: AE managing LFC, 3G, Edgewood Companies
- Tom Hemmingsen: Sales leadership, focusing on bookings targets
- Kaitlin Zidar: AE, working on land-and-expand deals
- Andrew Solomon: Operations support for enrollment data
- Jeremy: Medicare team lead
- Gary: Leadership (requested 2-1 updates)

External Stakeholders:
- Andy: Broker for Len Stoller (high-anxiety, needs support)
- Casey & Chris: USI brokers for Home Life
- Michael: Co-founder at Tiro
- Various decision-makers at KMC, RAPS, Home Life

CRITICAL MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

December 12, 2025: KMC quote presented  
December 15, 2025: Major enrollment success across mid-market groups ($300K+ ARR)  
December 16, 2025 (Meeting Date): Pipeline review and strategy session  
December 19, 2025: Extended deadline for 12/15 cohort enrollment  
Mid-January 2026: LFC meeting scheduled (moved from 2-1 to 3-1 consideration)  
February 1, 2026: Target start date for current pipeline opportunities  
Early January 2026: Medicare support documentation to be completed

NEXT STEPS & DEADLINES

Immediate Actions (By End of Week - December 20, 2025):

1. Retsy Holliday:
   - Follow up with Michael (Tiro) - offer additional discount if needed to secure 2-1
   - Check in with KMC on quote evaluation
   - Get decision from RAPS (coordinate with paychecks rep)
   - Confirm decision timeline with USI brokers (Home Life)
   - Push L.J. Rogers to sign contract by 2-1 for 2025 pricing (4-1 start, 210 employees, 108 enrolled)

2. Zach Egan:
   - Schedule call with Jeremy (Medicare team) to formalize Medicare support plan for RAPS (85 Medicare-eligible employees)
   - Confirm with Corey about Providence Network expansion timeline for quoting tool
   - Work with Medicare team on customer-facing documentation (target: early January 2026)

3. Chad Schneider:
   - Send gift to USI broker team (Casey & Chris) for Home Life deal

4. Denis Kalamar:
   - Follow up on Providence Network expansion impact for Edgewood Companies and other Tahoe/El Dorado/Nevada opportunities

Strategic Initiatives:

5. Medicare Workflow Improvements (Priority):
   - Phone number for Medicare population (top priority for Gary, timeline TBD)
   - One-pager documentation for sales cycle (early January 2026)
   - Training session for sales team on Medicare support (early January 2026)
   - Updated support page available (shared by Kara)

6. Pipeline Management:
   - Focus shifts to 3-1 (March 1) and 4-1 (April 1) opportunities after 2-1 deadline
   - Consider offering $10 PEPM incentives for early commitments on Q1 2026 starts
   - Address land-and-expand account management structure (ongoing discussion)

Outstanding Items:
- Expected enrollment field updates in Salesforce (Andrew Solomon working on aggregate solution)
- Providence Network expansion confirmation for quoting tool
- Account management team structure for renewals/upsells (future consideration)

RISK FACTORS

1. Medicare Support Gaps: Systemic workflow issues could impact customer satisfaction and enrollment success
2. Tight 2-1 Pipeline: Limited opportunities for February 1 start dates
3. Pricing Pressure: KMC significantly over budget; may require further discounting
4. Timeline Constraints: Multiple decisions needed by end of week for successful 2-1 implementations

OPPORTUNITIES

1. Strong Enrollment Performance: Exceeded expectations on 12/15 cohort
2. Broker Relationships: USI partnership showing strong results
3. Q1 2026 Pipeline: Several 3-1 and 4-1 opportunities in development
4. Product Improvements: Phone support and Medicare documentation coming in 2026

- Pain Point: Significant concerns about Medicare enrollment workflow/experience
- Priorities: Competitive pricing vs. group plans
- Timeline: Decision needed by end of week/early next week for successful 2-1 implementation
- Note: Owner expects only ~10 of 85 Medicare-eligible to actually enroll

HOME LIFE (USI Referral)
- Status: Highest likelihood to close
- Current State: Actively reviewing quote and SBCs over weekend
- Priorities: USI team believes Thatch is their only viable option
- Timeline: Decision expected by end of week for 2-1 start
- Relationship: Strong co-selling partnership with USI brokers (Casey and Chris)

LFC
- Status: Mid-year opportunity
- Current State: Self-funded group with 25 Medicare-eligible employees in New York
- Timeline: Meeting scheduled mid-January 2026; realistic target is 3-1 (March 1, 2026) vs. 2-1
- Challenge: Large group with Medicare complexity makes 2-1 unrealistic

EDGEWOOD COMPANIES
- Status: Early stage, awaiting Providence network expansion
- Location: Tahoe, El Dorado, Nevada area
- Blocker: Needs Providence network expansion to make proposal viable
- Timeline: Potentially mid-year 2026 once network updates are live

L.J. ROGERS
- Status: Pushing for January booking
- Size: 210 employees, 108-110 enrolled
- Industry: Trucking company, North Carolina-based
- Current State: Completed employee disruption analysis; very positive response
- Incentive: Offering 2025 pricing if contract signed by 2-1
- Timeline: 4-1 (April 1, 2026) enrollment; contract signature target by 2-1
- Next Step: Follow-up meeting with Danielle this week/early next week

LUND STOLLER (Enrolled Group - Medicare Issues)
- Status: Already enrolled (177 vs. 140 expected)
- Pain Point: Critical Medicare workflow gaps identified
- Challenge: 95-year-old owner (Len Stoller) and 68-year-old son need Medicare support; broker (Andy) is high-anxiety and requires significant handholding
- Systemic Issue: Medicare enrollment process insufficient for elderly population; tech barriers for 65+ demographic
- Optimization Goal: Need phone support line for Medicare population (in development for 2026)

OVERALL ORGANIZATIONAL CHALLENGES:
- Medicare workflow inadequate for 65+ population (tech barriers, lack of phone support)
- Need for improved sales cycle education on Medicare requirements
- One-pager being developed for January 2026 to clarify Medicare support scope
- Parts A & B enrollment not supported by Thatch (only Part D and supplementals)
- Phone number for Medicare support is top priority for 2026 (timeline TBD)

d44c6cd2-ec7b-494d-a2a6-e4927c24fdf1__71.title: Notes
d44c6cd2-ec7b-494d-a2a6-e4927c24fdf1__71.value:
Call Date / Timestamp: Tuesday, December 16, 2025  
Client Name / Account: Internal Team Meeting - Mid-Market Pipeline Review  
Call Type: Status

1. Objectives
- Review and update pipeline status for Q1 2025 (2/1 start dates) across the mid-market sales team
- Discuss Medicare workflow challenges and process improvements needed for implementation

2. Key Updates / Progress
- Strong OEP Performance: Over 300K ARR booked from enrolled members in one night; multiple mid-market groups exceeded expected enrollment (MetaSource: 260 enrolled vs 60 last week; NEPPA: ~1200 vs 600)
- Enrollment Success Rate: Almost all mid-market groups hit or exceeded 80% of expected enrollment threshold
- Deadline Extension: 12/19 is the new enrollment deadline for most groups
- Medicare Workflow Gap Identified: Current Medicare enrollment process is insufficient for the 65+ population; lacks phone support and adequate tech guidance
- 2/1 Pipeline Status: Limited active 2/1 opportunities; team pivoting focus to 3/1 and 4/1 start dates

3. Client Input / Feedback
- LenStoler (Retsy): Broker (Andy) is high-anxiety and requires significant handholding; 95-year-old owner and 68-year-old son need Medicare support urgently
- Wraps (Retsy): 85 Medicare-eligible employees (though only ~10 expected to enroll); client concerned about Medicare enrollment workflow
- Elco (Retsy): On-site experience revealed Medicare-eligible employees are tech-challenged; one employee became angry when told she couldn't remain on group plan; employees don't have laptops and struggle with basic computer tasks
- Multiple Brokers: Feedback that Thatch needs a phone number for Medicare population who are more comfortable calling than using digital tools

4. Action Items
- Zach → Work with Medicare team to create one-pager explaining Medicare support process for sales cycle → Early January 2025
- Zach → Schedule Medicare workflow training for sales team with updated customer-facing docs → Early January 2025
- Zach → Confirm with Corey if Providence network expansion will be available in quoting tool by 2/1 → This week (by 12/20/2025)
- Zach → Consult with Jeremy on additional Medicare questions to ask prospects before onboarding → This week (by 12/20/2025)
- Retsy → Follow up with Tiro (Michael) and offer additional discount for 2/1 vs mid-year start → This week (by 12/20/2025)
- Retsy → Check in with KMC on quote evaluation → This week (by 12/20/2025)
- Retsy → Get decision timeline from Paychex rep for Wraps → End of week (by 12/20/2025)
- Retsy → Follow up with USI team on Home Life decision timeline → End of week (by 12/20/2025)
- Retsy → Push LJ Rogers to sign contract by 2/1 with 2025 pricing offer → By 2/1/2025
- Chad → Send gift to USI broker team (Casey and Chris) → ASAP
- Denis → Follow up with LFC in mid-January for 3/1 evaluation → Mid-January 2025
- Team → Update expected enrollment fields in Salesforce for any remaining gaps → Ongoing
- Product Team → Develop phone support solution for Medicare population → 2025 (timeline TBD)

5. Notes
- Medicare Process Gaps: Current workflow requires tech-savvy users; Medicare-eligible population struggles with: creating accounts, filling Google forms, scheduling via Calendly, and using computers/smartphones. Phone support is top priority for 2025.
- Sales Cycle Education Needed: Medicare eligibility requirements (must enroll in Medicare when ICHRA-eligible) need to be communicated earlier in sales process, not just during implementation
- Pricing Flexibility: Team authorized to discount PEPM significantly (down to $10) to secure 2/1 deals vs later start dates
- ACA Workaround Discovered: 65+ individuals CAN enroll in ACA plans (not illegal), though Medicare is typically cheaper with better benefits; being used as stopgap for 3G group with Medicare enrollment delays
- Account Management Structure: No formal process yet for AE involvement in upsells/expansions; handling as one-offs with CS team collaboration for now
- Fiscal Year Impact: Bookings before 2/1 improve fiscal year results even if enrollment is later (4/1, 5/1)

Granola Summary

Objectives So Far:
- Review Q1 2025 pipeline and enrollment performance across mid-market team
- Address Medicare workflow challenges impacting client experience
- Identify and prioritize 2/1 start date opportunities
- Align on process improvements for Medicare-eligible populations

Progress Made:
- Exceptional OEP enrollment results: 300K+ ARR booked, most groups at/above 80% expected enrollment
- Identified critical Medicare workflow gaps through on-site client experiences
- Cleaned up pipeline; most groups extended to 12/19 deadline
- Strong broker relationships established (USI, Paychex)
- Multiple competitive quotes delivered (KMC, Wraps, Home Life, Tiro)

Outstanding Issues:
- Medicare Workflow: No phone support; tech barriers for 65+ population; unclear guidance on Parts A/B enrollment process
- Sales Cycle Communication: Medicare requirements not adequately explained upfront, causing client frustration
- Limited 2/1 Pipeline: Few realistic 2/1 opportunities remaining; need to pivot to 3/1 and beyond
- Product Gaps: Medicare support page needs updates; quoting tool may not reflect Providence network expansion
- Process Uncertainty: No formal structure for AE involvement in upsells/renewals

Next Steps:
- Develop Medicare one-pager and training materials for sales team (Early Jan 2025)
- Implement phone support solution for Medicare population (2025 priority)
- Push remaining 2/1 opportunities with aggressive pricing (by 12/20/2025)
- Shift focus to 3/1 and 4/1 pipeline development
- Improve upfront education about Medicare requirements in sales cycle
- Confirm Providence network availability in quoting tool
- Send broker gifts and maintain strong partner relationships

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
Account Notes - MM Pipeline Review Meeting
Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025

Meeting Context
This was an internal Thatch mid-market sales team pipeline review meeting, not a direct employer conversation. The meeting focused on Q1 2025 enrollment performance, Medicare workflow challenges, and pipeline opportunities for 2/1/2025 and beyond.

Key Discussion Points

1. Enrollment Performance & 2026 Considerations
- Strong Q1 Performance: Mid-market groups exceeded enrollment expectations, with most groups at or above 80% of expected enrollment
- Notable Successes:
  - MetaSource: Grew from 60 to 260 enrolled
  - NEPPA: Reached ~1,200 enrolled (from 600)
  - LenStoler: 177 enrolled vs. 140 expected (127% of target)
  - Elco: Over 100% of expected enrollment
- Deadline Extension: Most groups received extension to 12/19/2025 for final enrollment

2. Medicare Workflow Challenges (Critical Issue)
Major Pain Points Identified:
- Current Medicare enrollment process is insufficient for the Medicare-eligible population
- Technology barriers: Many Medicare-eligible employees struggle with creating accounts, using computers, and navigating digital forms
- Key Insight: This population needs phone support, not digital-only workflows
- Employees want immediate assistance, not scheduled appointments 4+ days out
- Lack of clear guidance on Parts A & B enrollment process

Specific Examples:
- LenStoler: 95-year-old owner and 68-year-old son need Medicare support; broker (Andy) requires significant handholding
- Elco: On-site experience revealed employees unable to use computers; one employee walked out when told she couldn't stay on group plan
- WRAPS: 85 Medicare-eligible employees (though only ~10 expected to enroll)

3. Sales Cycle Improvements Needed
- Medicare education must happen earlier in sales process, not just during implementation
- Need clear documentation that Medicare-eligible employees MUST transition to Medicare under ICRA (not optional)
- Sales reps need better training on what Thatch does/doesn't support for Medicare enrollment

Stakeholders Identified

Internal Thatch Team
- Zach Egan: Sales team lead, facilitating pipeline review
- Kara Kubarych: CS/Implementation oversight, tracking enrollment metrics
- Retsy Holliday: AE managing multiple accounts (LenStoler, Elco, FX, Tiro, KMC, WRAPS, Home Life, LJ Rogers)
- Denis Kalamar: AE managing 3G, LFC
- Tom Hemmingsen: Sales leadership
- Andrew Solomon: Sales operations/systems
- Kaitlin Zidar: AE, co-selling with Retsy
- Patricia Gorla, Donny Ho: Team members

Medicare Support Team
- Jeremy: Medicare specialist providing direct support
- Shelly: Medicare agent
- Hillary, Lauren: Additional Medicare support staff

External Stakeholders (Brokers/Partners)
- Andy: LenStoler broker (high-anxiety, requires significant support)
- Casey & Chris: USI brokers (strong co-selling relationship on Home Life deal)
- Paychex rep: Partner on WRAPS opportunity

Important Milestones & Timestamps

Completed Milestones
- 12/15/2025: Original enrollment deadline for most mid-market groups
- 12/16/2025 (Meeting Date): Pipeline review; over 300K ARR booked from previous night alone
- Week of 12/9/2025: Cost analysis presentations completed for multiple prospects

Upcoming Critical Dates
- 12/19/2025: Extended enrollment deadline for mid-market groups
- End of Week (12/20/2025): Target decision deadline for WRAPS and Home Life
- Mid-January 2026: LFC evaluation meeting scheduled
- Early January 2026: 
  - Medicare training for sales team planned
  - Updated customer-facing Medicare documentation to be released
  - Medicare one-pager for sales cycle to be completed

Future Milestones
- 2/1/2026: Target start date for several pipeline opportunities (Tiro, KMC, WRAPS, Home Life)
- 4/1/2026: Target for LJ Rogers (offering 2025 pricing as incentive)
- Q1 2026: Phone support for Medicare population expected to launch (timeline TBD)

Active Pipeline Opportunities

2/1/2026 Start Dates

1. Tiro (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Due diligence
- Context: Not currently offering benefits; founders met in Amsterdam
- Challenge: Decision-making speed
- Pricing: $20 PEPM (matched vendor pricing)
- Next Step: Check-in this week; willing to discount further to secure 2/1 start

2. KMC (Retsy Holliday & Kaitlin)
- Status: Quote presented 12/12/2025
- Context: Split-off from La-Z-Boy (non-La-Z-Boy branded furniture)
- Challenge: Quote is $200-300K higher than expected (but competitive with group quotes)
- Structure: Carve-out approach (hourly/part-time vs. incentive-based sellers)
- Next Step: Follow-up this week after they evaluate quotes

3. WRAPS (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Active discussion
- Size: 85 Medicare-eligible employees (only ~10 expected to enroll)
- Average age: 59 years old
- Challenge: Medicare workflow concerns
- Partner: Paychex
- Next Step: Decision needed by end of week/early next week for successful 2/1 implementation

4. Home Life (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Strong interest; highest likelihood of three 2/1 deals
- Partner: USI (Casey & Chris - strong co-selling relationship)
- Activity: Decision-maker emailed over weekend requesting SBCs and quote
- Next Step: Decision by end of week; gift to be sent to USI team

Mid-Year/Later Opportunities

5. LFC (Denis Kalamar)
- Status: Good meeting last week
- Size: 25 Medicare-eligible employees in New York
- Challenge: Self-funded group; not realistic for 2/1
- Next Step: Mid-January 2026 evaluation meeting with broker
- Moved to 3/1 or 4/1 target

6. LJ Rogers (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Pushing for 4/1/2026
- Size: 110 enrolled (210 total)
- Industry: Trucking company, North Carolina
- Activity: Hour-long employee disruption analysis completed last week
- Pricing: Offering 2025 pricing as incentive
- Next Step: Contract signature by 2/1 to lock in preferred pricing; Danielle meeting this week/early next

7. Edgewood Companies (Denis Kalamar)
- Status: Waiting on Providence network expansion
- Location: Tahoe, El Dorado, Nevada area
- Blocker: Needs Providence network update in quoting tool
- Timeline: Potentially mid-year 2026
- Next Step: Zach to confirm Providence network availability with Corey

Critical Next Steps & Action Items

Immediate (By 12/20/2025)
1. Retsy: Follow up with Tiro - offer additional discount to secure 2/1 start
2. Retsy: Check in with KMC on quote evaluation
3. Retsy: Get decision from WRAPS (via Paychex rep)
4. Retsy: Get decision from Home Life (via USI brokers)
5. Chad: Send gift to USI team (Casey & Chris) for Home Life deal
6. Retsy: Send LenStoler contact info to Chad for gift

Short-term (By End of December 2025)
7. All AEs: Continue pushing remaining groups through 12/19 enrollment deadline
8. Zach: Confirm Providence network expansion timeline with Corey for Edgewood and other Tahoe-area opportunities
9. Zach: Meet with Jeremy to formalize Medicare support plan for WRAPS (85 Medicare-eligible employees)

Early January 2026
10. Zach & Medicare Team: Complete Medicare one-pager for sales cycle
11. Zach & Medicare Team: Conduct Medicare training for sales team
12. Medicare Team: Release updated customer-facing Medicare documentation
13. Denis: Mid-January evaluation meeting with LFC and broker
14. Retsy: Push for LJ Rogers contract signature (offering 2025 pricing)

Strategic Initiatives (Q1 2026)
15. Product Team: Launch phone support for Medicare population (Gary's top priority)
16. Sales Team: Implement earlier Medicare education in sales cycle
17. Sales & CS Teams: Develop land-and-expand/account management structure for carve-outs and upsells
18. All Teams: Improve "expected enrollment" field usage in Salesforce for better forecasting

Key Insights & Recommendations

Medicare Workflow
- Critical Gap: Current digital-first approach doesn't work for Medicare population
- Solution in Progress: Phone support launching Q1 2026
- Immediate Need: Better sales cycle education and clearer documentation about Medicare requirements under ICRA

Sales Process
- Medicare eligibility must be discussed upfront, not during implementation
- Need to set expectations that Medicare-eligible employees MUST transition (not optional under ICRA)
- Consider offering aggressive discounts (down to $10 PEPM) to convert 3/1 and 4/1 opportunities to 2/1

Pipeline Health
- Strong Q1 enrollment performance (300K+ ARR booked 12/15 alone)
- Light 2/1 pipeline is expected and normal for mid-market
- Focus shifting to 3/1, 4/1, and 5/1 opportunities
- Bookings becoming increasingly important metric as company moves upmarket

Outstanding Questions/Concerns
1. Will Providence network expansion be available in quoting tool by end of December?
2. What is realistic Medicare support plan for groups with 85+ Medicare-eligible employees?
3. How will land-and-expand/upsell compensation work for AEs vs. CS team?
4. What will 2026 pricing look like for deals being quoted now with 2025 pricing?

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.title: Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.value:
Date: December 16, 2025

Pipeline Review Summary - Mid-Market Team

Active Prospects & Status:

Tiro (Due Diligence)
- Current State: Not offering benefits today
- Priority: Attract and retain talent
- Challenge: Decision-making delays despite strategic interest
- Timeline: Targeting 2/1/2026 start (uncertain)
- Action: Offering aggressive discounting (below $20 PEPM) to incentivize 2/1 close

KMC (Proposal Stage)
- Current State: Split-off from La-Z-Boy, creating new business entity
- What They Have: Virgin group, coming from La-Z-Boy benefits
- Challenge: Quote is $200-300K above budget expectations; similar to group market quotes
- Priority: Retain talent from La-Z-Boy transition
- Pain Point: Employee disruption analysis shows poor outcomes with Silver 1/Silver 25 plans
- Timeline: Evaluating for 2/1/2026; decision expected this week

Wraps (Proposal Stage)
- Current State: 85 Medicare-eligible employees, average age 59
- Challenge: Significant Medicare workflow concerns; only ~10 expected to enroll
- Pain Point: Older population struggles with digital enrollment process
- Timeline: Decision needed by end of week/early next week for successful 2/1/2026 implementation

Home Life (Proposal Stage - Highest Likelihood)
- Current State: USI referral, actively evaluating
- Status: Decision-makers engaged over weekend, requesting additional materials
- Priority: USI team views Thatch as "only option that makes sense"
- Timeline: Decision expected by end of week for 2/1/2026

LFC (Early Stage)
- Current State: 25 Medicare-eligible employees in New York
- Challenge: Self-funded group, not realistic for 2/1 timeline
- Timeline: Meeting mid-January; targeting 3/1/2026 or 4/1/2026

LJ Rogers (Advanced Stage)
- Current State: 110 enrolled, trucking company, North Carolina
- Status: Completed employee disruption analysis; positive reception
- Optimization Goal: Secure 2025 pricing for 2026 enrollment
- Timeline: Pushing for contract signature by 2/1/2026; 4/1/2026 enrollment

Current Clients - Key Issues:

LenStoler (Enrolled: 177 vs. Expected 140)
- Pain Point: Medicare enrollment crisis for S-corp owners (95-year-old founder, 68-year-old son)
- Challenge: Broker requires extensive handholding; high anxiety
- Issue: Owners not set up for Medicare transition despite multiple conversations
- Action: Escalated to Jeremy for direct Medicare support

Systemic Challenges Identified:

1. Medicare Workflow Gaps:
   - Tech barriers for 65+ population (can't navigate computers/email)
   - No phone support option (critical need identified)
   - Insufficient guidance on Social Security/Parts A&B enrollment
   - 4-day wait time for advisor meetings unacceptable to members

2. Sales Cycle Gaps:
   - Inadequate upfront education about mandatory Medicare transition for ICHRA
   - Need for earlier Medicare population education materials
   - One-pager in development for January 2026 deployment

3. Optimization Goals:
   - Phone number for Medicare population (top priority for 2026)
   - Improved Medicare support documentation
   - Sales team training on Medicare requirements (early January 2026)
   - Account management structure for upsells/renewals (under consideration)

Key Metrics:
- 300K+ ARR booked from mid-market groups as of 12/15/2025
- Most groups at or above 80% expected enrollment threshold
- 2/1 pipeline light but expected; focus shifting to 3/1 and 4/1 opportunities

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
IMPORTANT NOTE: This conversation is an internal Mid-Market Pipeline Review meeting among Thatch sales team members, not a conversation with a specific employer prospect about ICHRA. The question template appears misaligned with the actual conversation content. Below are comprehensive account notes from the actual discussion:

MEETING OVERVIEW
Meeting Type: MM Pipeline Review  
Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025  
Participants: Zach Egan (leader), Kara Kubarych, Retsy Holliday, Denis Kalamar, Tom Hemmingsen, Andrew Solomon, Kaitlin Zidar, Julia Korzeniowski, Chad Schneider, Patricia Gorla, Donny Ho

KEY DISCUSSION TOPICS

1. ENROLLMENT PERFORMANCE (12/15 Mid-Market Groups)
- Outstanding Performance: Over 300k ARR booked from enrolled members on 12/15
- Notable Successes:
  - Metasource: 60 enrolled → 260 enrolled
  - Napalm: 600 → ~1,200 enrolled
  - Elko: Over 100% of expected enrollment
  - Arc, 3G (92% after significant increase)
- Deadline Extension: 12/19 is the new deadline for most groups
- Expected Enrollment Metric: Identified as most powerful tracking tool; team needs to continue updating this field in Salesforce

2. MEDICARE WORKFLOW CHALLENGES (Critical Issue Identified)
Problem Statement: Current Medicare enrollment process is insufficient for the Medicare-eligible population

Specific Issues Identified:
- Tech literacy barriers for 65+ population
- Employees unable to navigate account creation, Google forms, or scheduling
- Lack of immediate support (4-day wait for advisor meetings unacceptable)
- Confusion about Medicare Parts A, B, D enrollment responsibilities
- Employees expecting in-person or phone support

Case Study - Len Stoller Group:
- 177 enrolled (vs. 140 expected) - excellent enrollment
- 95-year-old owner and 68-year-old son need Medicare transition support
- Broker (Andy) requires significant handholding
- Jeremy's calendar provided for direct Medicare consultation

Case Study - Elko:
- Employee literally said "I don't know how to do that" about opening a computer
- Many employees don't have laptops, only cell phones
- Product team (Megan) had to download Google Meet on phones for advisor meetings

Proposed Solutions:
- Phone number for Medicare population (top priority for Gary, timeline TBD for 2026)
- One-pager documentation for sales cycle (Medicare team working on this for early January 2026)
- Better sales cycle education about Medicare requirements
- Clarification: Thatch helps with Part D and supplementals, NOT Parts A & B enrollment

Important Clarification: 65+ individuals CAN enroll in ACA plans (not illegal), though Medicare is typically cheaper with better benefits. Six-month enrollment window exists (6 months before and after Medicare eligibility).

STAKEHOLDER IDENTIFICATION

Internal Thatch Team:
- Zach Egan: Sales team leader, pipeline management
- Kara Kubarych: CS/Implementation oversight, enrollment tracking
- Retsy Holliday: AE managing Tiro, KMC, RAPS, Home Life, Len Stoller, Elko, Sphinx
- Kaitlin Zidar: AE, co-selling with Retsy
- Denis Kalamar: AE managing LFC, 3G, Edgewood Companies
- Tom Hemmingsen: Sales leadership, fiscal year planning
- Andrew Solomon: Salesforce/data management
- Jeremy: Medicare specialist
- Gary: Leadership (prioritizing phone support solution)
- Corey: Product (Providence network expansion)

External Brokers/Partners:
- Andy: Len Stoller broker (high anxiety, needs significant support)
- Casey & Chris: USI brokers (Home Life deal)
- Paychecks rep: RAPS opportunity

ACTIVE OPPORTUNITIES & STATUS

2/1 START DATE OPPORTUNITIES (High Priority):

1. Tiro (Due Diligence)
- Size: Not offering benefits currently
- Status: Co-founder met in Amsterdam, still interested but slow decision-making
- Pricing: $20 PEPM (matched venture PEPM), no broker
- Strategy: Willing to discount further to secure 2/1 vs. mid-year start
- Next Step: Retsy checking in this week
- Timeline: Decision needed by end of week

2. KMC (Lazy Boy Split-Off)
- Size: New business entity (non-Lazy Boy branded furniture)
- Challenge: Quote is $200-300k higher than expected (but competitive with group quotes)
- Structure: Carve-out approach (hourly part-time + incentive-based sellers)
- Status: Quote presented 12/12/2025, awaiting decision
- Next Step: Retsy following up this week
- Likelihood: Moderate (numbers challenging but quality of benefits better)

3. RAPS
- Size: 85 Medicare-eligible employees (average age 59)
- Reality Check: Owner expects only ~10 of 85 would actually enroll
- Status: Pushed from 1/1 to 2/1 start
- Concern: Medicare workflow experience
- Pricing: Competitive quote
- Next Step: Decision needed by end of this week/early next week via Paychecks rep
- Action Item: Zach to work with Jeremy on Medicare support plan for potential 10 enrollees

4. Home Life (USI Referral)
- Status: HIGHEST LIKELIHOOD for 2/1
- Engagement: Decision-maker emailing over weekend, requesting SBCs and quotes
- Broker Support: USI team (Casey & Chris) fully advocating, excellent co-selling relationship
- Next Step: Retsy checking with USI brokers on realistic end-of-week decision timeline
- Action Item: Chad sending gift to USI broker team

3/1 AND LATER OPPORTUNITIES:

5. LFC
- Size: 25 Medicare-eligible employees in New York
- Status: Meeting scheduled mid-January 2026
- Reality: Too late for 2/1 (enrollment would need to start before decision)
- Timeline: Moved to 3/1 target

6. L.J. Rogers (4/1 Target)
- Size: 210 employees, 108-110 enrolled
- Type: Trucking company, North Carolina
- Status: Full employee disruption analysis completed, very positive reception
- Pricing Strategy: Offering 2025 pricing to incentivize early contract signing
- Next Step: Danielle meeting this week/early next week
- Goal: Contract signed by 2/1 for preferred pricing (even with 4/1 enrollment)

7. Edgewood Companies
- Location: Tahoe, El Dorado, Nevada area
- Blocker: Waiting on Providence network expansion
- Timeline: Potentially mid-year or later
- Action Item: Zach checking with Corey on Providence network timeline for quoting tool (target: end of December 2025)

CRITICAL MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

- 12/15/2025: Original enrollment deadline (exceeded expectations)
- 12/16/2025: This pipeline review meeting
- 12/19/2025: Extended enrollment deadline for most groups
- End of Week (12/20/2025): Decision deadline for Tiro, RAPS, Home Life
- End of December 2025: Target for Providence network in quoting tool
- Mid-January 2026: LFC meeting scheduled
- Early January 2026: Medicare one-pager documentation ready
- 2/1/2026: Critical start date for current pipeline opportunities
- 2/1/2026: Fiscal year end for bookings (important for investor/board reporting)

NEXT STEPS WITH DEADLINES

IMMEDIATE (This Week - by 12/20/2025):
1. Retsy: Follow up with Tiro (Michael) - offer additional discount if needed to secure 2/1
2. Retsy: Check in with KMC on quote evaluation and decision timeline
3. Retsy: Confirm with RAPS via Paychecks rep on end-of-week decision
4. Retsy: Confirm with USI brokers (Casey/Chris) on Home Life decision timeline
5. Chad: Send gift to USI broker team for Home Life deal
6. Zach: Ping Corey about Providence network expansion timeline for quoting tool
7. Zach: Work with Jeremy to formalize Medicare support plan for RAPS (potential 10 enrollees)

SHORT-TERM (Before 2/1/2026):
8. Retsy: Push L.J. Rogers to sign contract by 2/1 for 2025 pricing (even with 4/1 enrollment)
9. Medicare Team: Complete one-pager for sales cycle (early January 2026)
10. Zach: Lead training with Medicare team on updated customer-facing documentation
11. All AEs: Update expected enrollment field in Salesforce for any remaining blank accounts
12. Andrew: Explore automated solution for updating expected enrollment based on UM enrollment lists

ONGOING:
13. All AEs: Focus energy on 3/1 and 4/1 opportunities; pivot from 2/1 unless can incentivize with $10 PEPM or similar discounts
14. Team: Continue monitoring extended deadline groups through 12/19
15. Kara/CS Team: Track groups performing below 80% of expected enrollment

STRATEGIC INITIATIVES:
16. Gary (Leadership): Phone number solution for Medicare population (top priority, timeline TBD)
17. Product/Sales Alignment: Formalize account management structure for renewals and upsells (currently ad hoc)
18. Sales Process: Improve Medicare education in sales cycle to set proper expectations

PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS IDENTIFIED

1. Expected Enrollment Field: Proven most powerful metric; must be consistently updated
2. Medicare Communication: Need earlier, more comprehensive education in sales cycle
3. Upsell/Expansion Process: No formal structure for land-and-expand; handling as one-offs with CS collaboration
4. Broker Gifts: Workflow established through Allie's team and Chad
5. 2-1 Updates: All team members confirmed their 2-1s are updated per Gary's request

TEAM PERFORMANCE NOTES

- Team achieved exceptional enrollment results for 12/15 cohort
- Almost all mid-market groups at or above 80% expected enrollment threshold
- Strong collaboration between AEs and implementation managers
- Effective use of expected enrollment metric for tracking
- Quick response to last-minute enrollment pushes demonstrated team agility

I asked a question. It's a little random. If we have spare time. 
Zach Egan:
Go for it. 
Kaitlin Zidar:
So for some, deals are like land and expand. Have we considered how the AES will be involved? Like, Betsy and I just got off of this deal that had one person in New Mexico. So there's. Coming to us for a carve out, But it would be beneficial for her to remain involved since she already has all of the context. And right now, the way our team is structured is that CS should be owning that, but really, it's a little outside of their scope, as far as I know. And feel free to correct me if this is changing. There is no real incentive for upsells. So are we considering that as we're going forward and growing as a business? 
Zach Egan:
So. Yes, absolutely. And we've hinted the idea of a potential account management team that owns renewals and upsells. And that's their sole purpose, which has been how I've seen it in traditional Saas in the past. It is still very up in the air. I think right now the goal is to get sales reps out of the sales cycle so they can focus on the next new business. But in this case, I had a group called Embeda. I wanted to do a Texas carve out with like five people, but they were 250. And it's like, as a sales rep, I selfishly also want to be involved in that. So I think as those come up now and with no structure in place, let's just take them as one-offs. Like, honestly, like Rats, if you want to be involved post-sale on that one, like, I would just say, let's partner with, you know, Julia and Karen, the CS team, to make sure we're all like, lockstep on this. Or, like, if you come to periodic check-ins to help out how you can, awesome. But Well, we also, we just got to get on the same page with the teams. But for now, current state, I'm all for it. If it's going to lead to expansion. 
Tom Hemmingsen:
Thanks. 
Kaitlin Zidar:
That makes sense. And I wouldn't be surprised if that's the way some of the larger groups also approach it, just knowing that it's a change. 
Zach Egan:
For sure. I think, yeah, we'll see what future that looks like, too. And like the enterprise space, like, you know, if you're holding on to just a handful of accounts and focusing on upsells, like, there's. Right now, the main way that we upsell is increased enrollment. And there's also potential changes in the future with the marketplace. But yeah, it's in the adolescent stages of any kind of plan. So we'll just do it as a one-off for now. Thank you. All right, squad. Anything else? See you out there. Thank you. 
Retsy Holliday:
Thanks, guys.

d44c6cd2-ec7b-494d-a2a6-e4927c24fdf1__71.title: Notes
d44c6cd2-ec7b-494d-a2a6-e4927c24fdf1__71.value:
Note: This conversation series contains only ONE internal team meeting (MM Pipeline Review), not multiple client calls. Below are structured notes adapted to capture the discussion of multiple client accounts within this single internal meeting.

Call Date / Timestamp: Tuesday, December 16, 2025
Meeting Type: Internal Pipeline Review (Mid-Market Team)
Meeting Title: MM Pipeline Review

1. Objectives
- Review and update 2-1 (February 1st) pipeline opportunities for mid-market team
- Discuss Medicare enrollment workflow challenges and gaps
- Assess enrollment performance for 12-15 mid-market groups

2. Key Updates / Progress
- Enrollment Success: Over 300k in ARR booked from enrolled members in one night
- Strong Performance: Almost all mid-market groups at or above 80% expected enrollment threshold
- Deadline Extension: 12-19 is the new deadline extension for most groups
- Medicare Workflow Gap Identified: Current Medicare support process insufficient for tech-challenged population
- Phone Number Solution: Top priority for Gary - phone support line in development for 2026 (timeline TBD)
- Medicare Documentation: One-pager being developed for sales cycle to be ready early January 2026

3. Client Input / Feedback (by Account)

Lund Stoller (Retsy Holliday):
- Exceeded expectations: 177 enrolled vs 140 expected
- Medicare issue: 95-year-old owner and 68-year-old son need Medicare enrollment support
- Broker (Andy) is high-anxiety, requires significant handholding
- Broker feedback: Medicare workflow inadequate, needs phone support

Elko (Retsy Holliday):
- Over 100% of expected enrollment achieved
- On-site experience revealed: Medicare-eligible employees struggled with technology
- One employee walked out angry when told she couldn't remain on group plan

Sphinx (Retsy Holliday):
- Challenging: 1 employee across every location
- 45 previously enrolled out of 400, expecting slight increase

Metasource:
- Impressive growth: 60 enrolled last week → 260 at end

Napalm:
- Strong performance: ~600 → close to 1200 enrolled

3G (Denis Kalamar):
- Increased to 92% enrollment (was very low previously)
- 7 Medicare-eligible employees enrolling in ACA plans as stopgap until Medicare plans ready (end of January or later)

Arc:
- Ended in good spot after being challenging

Perfect Game (Zach Egan):
- Expected 130, exceeded that threshold

Belonging Medical Group (Tom Hemmingsen):
- Multi-EIN group with partners

4. Action Items

Medicare Workflow Improvements:
- [Zach Egan] → Meet with Medicare team to formalize support plan for groups with large Medicare populations → Week of 2025-12-16
- [Medicare Team] → Complete one-pager for sales cycle explaining Medicare enrollment process → Early January 2026
- [Product/Gary] → Develop phone support line for Medicare population → TBD 2026

Pipeline - 2-1 Opportunities:

Tiro (Retsy Holliday):
- [Retsy] → Check in with Michael this week about 2-1 decision → Week of 2025-12-16
- [Retsy] → Offer maximum discount to incentivize 2-1 vs 3-1 start → Week of 2025-12-16

KMC (Retsy Holliday):
- [Retsy] → Follow up on quote evaluation (presented 2025-12-12) → Week of 2025-12-16
- Note: Quote is $200-300k higher than expected, but competitive with group quotes

Wraps (Retsy Holliday):
- [Retsy] → Get decision by end of week/early next week for successful 2-1 → By 2025-12-20
- [Zach] → Work with Jeremy on Medicare questions for 85 Medicare-eligible employees → Week of 2025-12-16

Home Life (Retsy Holliday):
- [Retsy] → Get decision from USI brokers by end of week → By 2025-12-20
- [Chad Schneider] → Send gift to USI broker team → Week of 2025-12-16

LFC (Denis Kalamar):
- [Denis] → Meeting scheduled with client and broker → Mid-January 2026
- Note: Moved to 3-1 timeline due to 25 Medicare-eligible employees in NY

L.J. Rogers (Retsy Holliday - 4-1 opportunity):
- [Retsy] → Push for contract signature by 2-1 to secure 2025 pricing → By 2026-02-01
- 110 enrolled, trucking company in North Carolina
- [Danielle] → Follow-up meeting → Week of 2025-12-16 or early next week

Edgewood Companies (Denis Kalamar):
- [Zach] → Check with Corey on Providence Network expansion timeline in quoting tool → Week of 2025-12-16
- [Denis] → Propose 2-1 or mid-year transition once Providence network updates available → TBD

General:
- [All AEs] → Update expected enrollment field in Salesforce for any remaining blank groups → Ongoing
- [All AEs] → Focus energy on 3-1 and 4-1 opportunities with incentives for early commitment → Ongoing

5. Notes

Medicare Workflow Challenges Identified:
- Tech-challenged population struggles with: creating accounts, filling Google forms, scheduling Calendly links
- Many don't have laptops, only cell phones
- Prefer phone support over digital workflows
- Need immediate support, not appointments 4 days out
- Compliance issue: Medicare-eligible employees MUST enroll in Medicare under ICHRA (not optional)
- Gap in sales cycle: Need earlier education about Medicare requirements
- Current support: Parts D and supplementals only; NOT Parts A & B enrollment
- Broker feedback: Phone number is critical for this population

ACA Plan Option for 65+:
- Discovered: 65+ can enroll in ACA plans (not illegal), though Medicare is typically cheaper with better benefits
- Can be used as stopgap while Medicare enrollment processes

Team Structure Discussion:
- Question raised about Land & Expand ownership between Sales and CS
- No formal account management team for renewals/upsells yet
- Current approach: Case-by-case collaboration between Sales and CS teams

Fiscal Year Considerations:
- Bookings before 2-1 improve fiscal year metrics
- Enrolled lives count toward the year they enroll (4-1 enrollment = 2026)
- Bookings are increasingly important as company moves upmarket

Expected Enrollment Field:
- Critical metric for tracking performance vs. assumptions
- Not a calculated field - must be manually entered in Salesforce
- Used when expected to vary from assumed enrollment (prior year numbers)
- Helps CS team determine appropriate push strategies

Granola Summary

Objectives So Far:
- Review 2-1 pipeline opportunities and assess realistic close timelines
- Address Medicare enrollment workflow gaps and develop improvement plan
- Celebrate strong enrollment performance across 12-15 mid-market cohort
- Ensure all expected enrollment data is updated in Salesforce
- Pivot focus to 3-1 and 4-1 opportunities given light 2-1 pipeline

Progress Made:
- Exceeded enrollment expectations across nearly all mid-market groups (300k+ ARR in one night)
- Identified specific Medicare workflow pain points through on-site experiences
- Secured meetings/follow-ups for key 2-1 opportunities (Tiro, KMC, Wraps, Home Life)
- Initiated Medicare support improvements (one-pager, phone line development)
- Clarified ACA enrollment option for 65+ as potential stopgap solution
- Updated multi-EIN tracking for complex groups

Outstanding Issues:
- Medicare Workflow: Current process inadequate for tech-challenged population; lacks phone support
- Sales Cycle Education: Need earlier/better communication about Medicare requirements and process
- Light 2-1 Pipeline: Only handful of realistic 2-1 opportunities remaining
- Pricing Pressure: Some quotes (KMC) coming in $200-300k higher than client expectations
- Providence Network: Quoting tool updates needed for Tahoe/El Dorado/Nevada opportunities
- Account Management Structure: No formal process for Land & Expand/upsell ownership between Sales and CS

Next Steps:
- Secure decisions on 4 key 2-1 opportunities by end of week (2025-12-20)
- Complete Medicare one-pager for sales cycle (early January 2026)
- Develop phone support line for Medicare population (2026, timeline TBD)
- Shift focus to 3-1 and 4-1 pipeline with early commitment incentives
- Verify Providence Network expansion timeline for pending opportunities
- Continue updating expected enrollment fields in Salesforce
- Send gift to USI broker team supporting Home Life deal

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
IMPORTANT CLARIFICATION: This conversation was an internal Thatch Mid-Market Pipeline Review meeting held on December 16, 2025, not a conversation with a specific employer/prospect about ICHRA interest. The notes below reflect the actual content discussed.

ACCOUNT NOTES - MM Pipeline Review Meeting
Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025

MEETING OVERVIEW
Internal pipeline review focused on 2/1/2026 opportunities, OEP results for 12/15 mid-market groups, and Medicare enrollment workflow challenges.

KEY DISCUSSION POINTS

1. Open Enrollment Performance (12/15 Groups)
- Strong overall performance: Over 300k ARR booked from enrolled members on 12/15
- Notable successes:
  - Metasource: Grew from 60 to 260 enrolled
  - Napalm: Grew from ~600 to ~1,200 enrolled
  - Elko: Exceeded 100% of expected enrollment
  - Lund Stoller: 177 enrolled vs. 140 expected (127% performance)
- Most mid-market groups met or exceeded 80% enrollment threshold
- Deadline extended to 12/19/2025 for final push

2. Critical Medicare Workflow Gaps Identified
- Major Issue: Current Medicare enrollment process insufficient for Medicare-eligible population
- Specific Challenges:
  - Tech literacy barriers for 65+ population
  - Confusion about Parts A & B enrollment requirements (Thatch does NOT support this)
  - Lack of phone support (population prefers calling vs. online forms)
  - 4-day wait time for advisor meetings unacceptable for on-site enrollments
  - Misinformation about ICHRA Medicare requirements during sales cycle
- Impact: Broker complaints, employee frustration, operational strain

3. 2/1/2026 Pipeline Status
Limited 2/1 opportunities in flight:

Active 2/1 Deals:
- Tiro (Retsy): No current benefits, decision pending this week, $20 PEPM (no broker)
- KMC Wraps (Retsy): Lazy Boy spin-off, quote $200-400k higher than expected, competitive with group quotes
- Wraps (Retsy): 85 Medicare-eligible employees (owner estimates only 10 would enroll), decision needed by end of week
- Home Life (Retsy): USI referral, highest likelihood of closing, decision expected end of week

Mid-Year/Later Opportunities:
- LFC (Denis): Meeting mid-January, likely 3/1 or later due to 25 Medicare-eligible employees in NY
- L.J. Rogers (Retsy): 110 enrolled, trucking company NC, pushing for 4/1 with 2025 pricing incentive

STAKEHOLDERS & RESPONSIBILITIES

Internal Thatch Team:
- Zach Egan: Sales Leader, pipeline management, Medicare strategy coordination
- Kara Kubarych: CS/Implementation Lead, OEP tracking, enrollment metrics
- Retsy Holliday: AE managing Tiro, KMC, Wraps, Home Life, L.J. Rogers
- Denis Kalamar: AE managing LFC, 3G, Edgewood Companies
- Tom Hemmingsen: AE, bookings focus
- Kaitlin Zidar: AE, land-and-expand strategy questions
- Andrew Solomon: Sales Operations, Salesforce data management
- Jeremy: Medicare team lead
- Gary: Leadership (requested 2/1 updates)
- Chad Schneider: Gift/broker relations coordination
- Julia Korzeniowski: Marketing/broker gifts

External Brokers:
- USI Team (Casey & Chris): Co-selling on Home Life deal
- Andy: Lund Stoller broker (high-anxiety, requires significant handholding)
- Paychecks Rep: Wraps opportunity

CRITICAL MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

December 15, 2025: 
- Original OEP deadline for mid-market groups
- Strong enrollment results posted (300k+ ARR)

December 16, 2025 (Meeting Date):
- Pipeline review conducted
- Medicare workflow gaps formally identified
- 2/1 opportunities assessed

December 19, 2025: 
- Extended OEP deadline for final enrollment push

End of Week (December 20, 2025):
- Target decision date for Wraps, Home Life, Tiro
- Retsy to check in with all active 2/1 prospects

Mid-January 2026:
- LFC meeting scheduled (Denis)
- Expected timeline for Medicare support documentation

Early January 2026:
- Medicare training session planned (led by Medicare team)
- Updated customer-facing Medicare documentation to be released
- Phone support for Medicare population (top priority, timeline TBD)

February 1, 2026: 
- Target start date for active pipeline opportunities
- Fiscal year-end for bookings

NEXT STEPS & DEADLINES

Immediate (By December 20, 2025):

1. Retsy Holliday:
   - Follow up with Tiro on decision (offer aggressive discount if needed to secure 2/1)
   - Check in with KMC on quote evaluation
   - Confirm Wraps decision timeline with Paychecks rep
   - Coordinate with USI team on Home Life decision
   - Push L.J. Rogers to sign by 2/1 for 2025 pricing

2. Zach Egan:
   - Confirm Providence Network expansion timeline with Corey for quoting tool
   - Coordinate with Jeremy on Medicare support requirements for Wraps (85 Medicare-eligible)
   - Develop Medicare question framework for sales qualification

3. Chad Schneider:
   - Send gift to USI broker team (Casey & Chris) for Home Life deal

4. Team-Wide:
   - Continue final enrollment push through 12/19 deadline
   - Update expected enrollment fields in Salesforce for any remaining gaps

Short-Term (January 2026):

1. Medicare Team (Jeremy, Lauren, Hillary):
   - Conduct training session for sales team on Medicare support scope
   - Finalize one-pager for sales cycle explaining Medicare enrollment process
   - Update support documentation (already in progress per Kara)

2. Zach Egan:
   - Distribute Medicare one-pager to all sales reps for prospect communications
   - Implement requirement to share Medicare documentation in every sales cycle

3. Denis Kalamar:
   - Mid-January meeting with LFC and broker
   - Evaluate Edgewood Companies for mid-year opportunity (pending Providence Network expansion)

Strategic Priorities:

1. Phone Support for Medicare Population: Top priority per Gary, timeline TBD
2. Account Management Structure: Evaluate need for dedicated renewal/upsell team
3. Medicare Education in Sales Cycle: Implement earlier, more comprehensive education about ICRA Medicare requirements
4. Pricing Flexibility: Willing to discount aggressively (as low as possible) to convert 2/1 opportunities vs. 3/1 or later

OPERATIONAL NOTES

- Expected Enrollment Field: Critical metric for tracking performance, must be filled out in Salesforce for all groups
- Bookings vs. Enrollments: Bookings before 2/1 count toward FY2025 even if enrollment is later
- Land-and-Expand: No formal structure yet; handle as one-offs with CS collaboration
- 2025 vs. 2026 Pricing: Can offer 2025 pricing as incentive for early commitments

RISKS & CONCERNS

1. Medicare Workflow: Significant gap in service delivery, causing broker complaints and employee dissatisfaction
2. Limited 2/1 Pipeline: Very few realistic 2/1 opportunities remaining
3. Large Medicare Populations: Groups with 25+ Medicare-eligible employees present operational challenges
4. Pricing Competitiveness: Some quotes coming in $200-400k higher than client expectations
5. Sales Cycle Education: Medicare requirements not adequately communicated upfront, causing surprises during implementation

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
Account Notes - MM Pipeline Review Meeting
Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025

Meeting Overview
This was an internal Thatch mid-market sales team pipeline review meeting, not a single employer conversation. The team discussed multiple prospects, Medicare workflow challenges, and 2.1 (February 1, 2026) enrollment deadlines.

Key Stakeholders (Thatch Internal Team)

Sales Team:
- Zach Egan - Team Lead/Manager
- Retsy Holliday - Account Executive
- Denis Kalamar - Account Executive
- Andrew Solomon - Account Executive
- Kaitlin Zidar - Account Executive
- Patricia Gorla - Team Member
- Donny Ho - Team Member

Supporting Teams:
- Kara Kubarych - Customer Success/Implementation Lead
- Julia Korzeniowski - Operations/Support
- Chad Schneider - Marketing/Gifts Coordinator
- Tom Hemmingsen - Leadership (Thatch Internal)

Critical Issues Identified

1. Medicare Workflow Gaps
Problem: Current Medicare enrollment process is insufficient for the 65+ population
- Tech-challenged population struggles with online account creation
- No phone support option currently available
- Employees want immediate assistance, not scheduled calls 4+ days out
- Brokers requesting dedicated phone number for Medicare-eligible members

Impact: Lund Stoller group (177 enrolled vs 140 expected) experiencing significant Medicare enrollment friction with 95-year-old owner and 68-year-old son needing support

Planned Solutions:
- Phone number for Medicare population (top priority for Gary, timeline TBD for 2026)
- One-pager documentation being developed for sales cycle (early January 2026)
- Updated customer-facing docs and training planned for early January 2026

2. Sales Cycle Education Gaps
- Medicare eligibility requirements not clearly communicated upfront
- Employers surprised that Medicare-eligible employees MUST transition to Medicare under ICHRA
- Need earlier education in sales process about Medicare population requirements

Active Prospects & Pipeline Status

Priority 2.1 (February 1, 2026) Opportunities

1. Tiro (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Due Diligence
- Background: Not currently offering benefits, want to attract/retain talent
- Challenge: Decision-making speed
- Pricing: Already at $20 PEPM (matched venture pricing), no broker
- Next Steps: Check-in this week; willing to discount further to secure 2.1 vs 3.1 start date
- Decision Needed: End of week/early next week

2. Home Life (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Highest likelihood for 2.1
- Broker: USI (Casey and Chris - strong advocates)
- Activity: Decision-maker actively reviewing SBCs and quotes over weekend
- Next Steps: Retsy checking with USI brokers for realistic end-of-week decision timeline
- Action Item: Chad Schneider sending gift to USI broker team

3. Wraps (Retsy Holliday)
- Status: Strong interest, Medicare concerns
- Size: 85 Medicare-eligible employees (owner estimates only ~10 would enroll)
- Demographics: Average age 59 years old
- Pricing: Competitive quote despite older population
- Concerns: Medicare enrollment workflow
- Next Steps: 
  - Decision needed by end of week/early next week for successful 2.1
  - Zach to consult with Jeremy on Medicare support plan for 85 eligible members
  - Back-channeling with Paychecks rep

4. KMC (Retsy Holliday & Caitlin)
- Status: Evaluating quotes
- Background: Split-off from Lazy Boy (non-Lazy Boy branded furniture)
- Challenge: Coming in $200-300K more expensive than expected (but group quotes similar)
- Structure: Multiple employee types (hourly part-time, incentive-based sellers) - separate quotes for each
- Quote Presented: Thursday last week
- Consideration: Carve-out options being evaluated
- Next Steps: Follow-up this week after they review options

Future Pipeline (3.1/4.1/5.1)

5. LFC (Denis Kalamar)
- Status: Mid-January meeting scheduled
- Size: 25 Medicare-eligible employees in New York
- Type: Self-funded group
- Timeline: 3.1 (March 1, 2026) more realistic than 2.1
- Challenge: Providence Network expansion needed for viability
- Next Steps: Meeting mid-January with broker to evaluate

6. L.J. Rogers (Retsy Holliday & Caitlin)
- Status: Pushing for early booking with 2025 pricing
- Type: Trucking company, North Carolina
- Size: 210 employees, 108 enrolled
- Progress: Full employee disruption analysis completed last week (1-hour session)
- Broker: Danielle (meeting scheduled this week/early next week)
- Strategy: Sign contract by 2.1 for preferred 2025 pricing, 4.1 enrollment
- Next Steps: Push for contract signature by 2.1 deadline

7. Edgewood Companies (Denis Kalamar)
- Status: Waiting on Providence Network expansion
- Location: Tahoe, El Dorado, Nevada area
- Blocker: Need Providence network updates in quoting tool
- Timeline: Potentially mid-year or later
- Next Steps: Zach to confirm with Corey on Providence Network availability timeline

Important Milestones & Timestamps

December 15, 2024 (Previous Night):
- Over 300K ARR booked from enrolled members
- Mid-market groups landed in "really good spot"
- Metasource: 60 enrolled → 260 enrolled
- Napalm: 600 → 1,200 enrolled
- Almost all mid-market groups at or above 80% expected enrollment threshold

December 19, 2025:
- Extended deadline for 12.15 groups
- Minimal movement expected but some groups still pushing

Week of December 16, 2025:
- Multiple prospect decisions needed for viable 2.1 implementations
- Medicare workflow issues escalating

Early January 2026:
- Medicare one-pager and updated documentation rollout
- Training session planned with Medicare team
- LFC meeting mid-January

February 1, 2026 (2.1 Deadline):
- Critical enrollment start date for current pipeline
- Fiscal year consideration for bookings

Key Operational Updates

Enrollment Performance
- Team exceeded expectations on 12.15 mid-market cohort
- Very few groups underperformed 80% expected enrollment threshold
- "Power of procrastination" - many last-minute improvements

Expected Enrollment Field
- Critical metric for tracking performance
- Not a calculated field - must be manually added in Salesforce
- Team mostly compliant; Andrew working on system to update multi-EIN groups at aggregate level
- Outstanding items: ~50 separated EINs from 30+ EIN groups

Pricing Strategy
- Willing to go as low as possible on PEPM to convert 2.1 vs 3.1 deals
- Offering 2025 pricing for early 2026 bookings to incentivize contract signatures

Strategic Considerations

Account Management Structure
- Discussion about Land & Expand ownership
- Current gap: CS team handles renewals but no incentive structure for upsells
- Consideration: Potential account management team for renewals/upsells
- Current approach: Case-by-case collaboration between sales and CS (e.g., New Mexico carve-out)

Product Roadmap Needs
- Providence Network expansion critical for California/Nevada opportunities
- Corey to confirm timeline for quoting tool updates
- Medicare phone support as top 2026 priority

Next Steps & Deadlines

Immediate (This Week - December 16-20, 2025):
1. Retsy: Check-in with Tiro (Michael) - explore additional discounting for 2.1 commitment
2. Retsy: Follow up with Home Life decision-makers and USI brokers for end-of-week decision
3. Retsy: Check-in with KMC on quote evaluation
4. Retsy: Confirm Wraps timeline with Paychecks rep
5. Zach: Consult with Jeremy on Medicare support plan for Wraps (85 eligible members)
6. Zach: Confirm Providence Network timeline with Corey for quoting tool
7. Chad: Send gift to USI broker team (Casey and Chris)
8. Retsy/Caitlin: Push L.J. Rogers for contract signature by 2.1

Early January 2026:
- Medicare one-pager rollout to all sales reps
- Medicare team training session
- Updated customer-facing Medicare documentation

Mid-January 2026:
- Denis: Meeting with LFC and broker to evaluate 3.1 opportunity

February 1, 2026:
- Target contract signatures for preferred pricing (even if enrollment is later)
- Critical deadline for 2.1 enrollment starts

Risk Factors
- Light 2.1 pipeline (expected, consistent with last year)
- Medicare workflow gaps creating friction with brokers and employers
- Pricing competitiveness on older demographic groups
- Multi-EIN group complexity for tracking
- Providence Network expansion timing uncertainty

Wins to Celebrate
- Exceptional 12.15 enrollment performance across mid-market
- Strong broker relationships (USI, Paychecks)
- Effective employee disruption analysis driving engagement
- Team collaboration and communication on complex deals

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
Account Notes: EvolveNChange, LLC - Thatch Onboarding Call

Date: Tuesday, December 16, 2025  
Company: EvolveNChange, LLC  
Call Participants:
- Taryn Livingstone (Thatch Representative)
- Leticia (Company Owner/Primary Contact)

1. KEY POINTS DISCUSSED

Primary Issue Identified - ICHRA Eligibility Concern
CRITICAL FINDING: During the call, it was discovered that the company structure presents a significant eligibility issue:
- Company is structured as an LLC (not taxed as C-Corp)
- Both Leticia and Jeffrey Stewart appear to be owners of the LLC
- LLC owners do NOT qualify for ICHRA coverage through Thatch because they already receive tax benefits by including insurance as a business expense
- Only non-owner employees would be eligible for ICHRA through Thatch

Platform Navigation & Technical Issues
- Leticia experienced difficulty accessing the platform and viewing plan options
- Password reset link was not initially received (potential email delivery issue)
- Confusion about why bank account information was required before viewing plans
- Leticia expressed frustration about the onboarding process and timing constraints

Plan Structure Reviewed
- Monthly employer allowance set at: $550 per employee
- Example plan shown: Total cost $1,234.70 (Employer pays $550, Employee pays $684.70)
- Plans available are similar to marketplace options but with pre-tax benefit advantage
- No marketplace subsidies currently available to the company

Alternative Recommendation Provided
- For LLC owners: Purchase insurance directly through the marketplace (cannot use ICHRA)
- Eligible employees (non-owners): Can be covered through Thatch ICHRA

2. STAKEHOLDERS IDENTIFIED

| Name | Role | Responsibilities | Eligibility Status |
|------|------|------------------|-------------------|
| Leticia | LLC Owner / Primary Contact | Decision maker, account administrator | NOT eligible for ICHRA (owner) |
| Jeffrey Stewart | Co-owner/Employee | Listed in employee roster | Likely NOT eligible (appears to be owner) |
| Taryn Livingstone | Thatch Sales Representative | Platform guidance, eligibility clarification | N/A |
| Thatch Support Team | Technical Support | Password reset assistance (thread initiated) | N/A |

Note: Leticia mentioned being referred by "another CoD League" member who may not be an S-Corp, suggesting she should verify their structure.

3. IMPORTANT MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

December 16, 2025 - Initial Onboarding Call:
- 00:00-05:00 - Technical difficulties with login/password reset
- 05:00-10:00 - Navigation through platform to view plan options
- 10:00-15:00 - Review of plan costs and allowance structure ($550/month)
- 15:00-20:00 - Discussion of company structure (LLC)
- 20:00-25:00 - CRITICAL MOMENT: Discovery that LLC owners are ineligible for ICHRA
- 25:00-30:00 - Clarification that only non-owner employees would qualify

Key Quote from Leticia: "I really need to get this squared away today. Like, I'm not going to have any other time for the rest of the year to get this done. This has been such a frustrating process."

4. NEXT STEPS & ACTION ITEMS

Immediate Actions Required:

For Leticia (Company Owner):
- [ ] URGENT: Verify Jeffrey Stewart's ownership status in the LLC
- [ ] Determine if there are any non-owner employees who would be eligible for ICHRA
- [ ] If pursuing ICHRA for eligible employees only: Complete bank account setup in platform
- [ ] For herself and Jeffrey (as owners): Explore marketplace insurance options directly
- [ ] Deadline: End of year 2025 (per Leticia's stated timeline constraint)

For Thatch Team:
- [ ] Monitor support ticket for password reset issue resolution
- [ ] Follow up with Leticia to confirm company structure and employee eligibility
- [ ] Provide marketplace guidance for LLC owners if needed
- [ ] Responsible Party: Taryn Livingstone to follow up

For Referral Source Verification:
- [ ] Leticia to check with referring "CoD League" member about their company structure
- [ ] Confirm whether referral source is actually eligible (may not be S-Corp as Leticia mentioned)

ACCOUNT STATUS

Current Status: ⚠️ PENDING ELIGIBILITY VERIFICATION  
Risk Level: HIGH - Fundamental eligibility issue identified  
Onboarding Status: Incomplete - Company not fully onboarded  
Urgency: HIGH - Customer has year-end deadline

Recommended Follow-up: Within 24-48 hours to clarify employee roster and ownership structure before proceeding with onboarding.

ADDITIONAL NOTES

- Customer expressed significant frustration with the process
- Time sensitivity is critical (no availability after December 2025)
- May need to pivot strategy entirely if no non-owner employees exist
- Consider providing clearer upfront eligibility screening for LLC structures to avoid similar situations

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.value:
Date: 2025-12-16

Prospect: EvolveNChange, LLC (Leticia - Owner)

Current Situation:
- LLC structure with two owners (Leticia and Jeffrey Stewart)
- Do not qualify for marketplace subsidies
- Registered with Thatch but not fully onboarded
- Referred by another COD League member

Pain Points & Challenges:
- Extremely frustrated with onboarding process
- Technical issues: difficulty logging in, password reset not working
- Confusion about plan selection process and pricing structure
- Required to provide bank information before seeing plan options/making decision
- Severe time constraints - busy period, limited availability rest of year

Key Discovery:
- As LLC owners, Leticia and Jeffrey do NOT qualify for ICRA (Individual Coverage Health Reimbursement Arrangement) through Thatch
- LLC owners already receive tax benefits by including insurance as business expense
- Only non-owner employees would be eligible for Thatch coverage

Solution Provided:
- Owners should purchase insurance directly through marketplace
- Non-owner employees can be covered through Thatch ICRA with pre-tax allowance ($550 monthly allowance discussed)
- Employee contribution would be plan cost minus employer allowance

Timeline:
- URGENT: Needs resolution immediately (same day)
- No availability for rest of 2025
- Will follow up after verifying employee eligibility status

Next Steps:
- Leticia to verify if they have any non-owner employees eligible for coverage
- Will reconnect with Thatch if eligible employees identified

- Determine whether to proceed with Thatch coverage for employees only, since LLC owners (Leticia and Jeffrey Stewart) do not qualify for ICRA
