fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
Account Notes - Summerset Memory Care & Assisted Living
Date: Monday, December 15, 2025  
Call Type: Onboarding & Platform Training  
Thatch Representative: Caroline Clark  

1. KEY DISCUSSION POINTS

Platform Implementation Status
- Employer Profile Setup: Mason completed employer profile setup for Memory Care (MC) location. Assisted Living (AL) and ALNC accounts still need completion.
- Multiple Locations: Employer operates two separate facilities requiring distinct Thatch accounts:
  - Memory Care (MC) - completed setup
  - Assisted Living (AL/ALNC) - setup in progress during call
- Bank Account Connection: Mason successfully connected bank account via Plaid for payment processing
- Payroll Configuration: Configured payroll schedule and weekend payment preferences

Benefits Structure
- Medical Insurance: Transitioning to Thatch platform with multiple carrier options (28+ plans available depending on location)
- Dental & Vision: Remaining separate through existing provider (administered via EASE platform with HuB/Jessica Reyes)
- Life Insurance: Continuing separately through EASE, not included in Thatch offering
- Broker of Record: Thatch assumes broker of record status for medical benefits

Employee Eligibility & Coverage
- Full-Time Employees Only: Benefits offered exclusively to full-time employees; part-time employees should not receive invitations
- Coverage Effective Date: January 1, 2026 (for employees enrolling by December 22, 2025)
- Enrollment Deadline: December 22, 2025 - critical deadline for January 1st coverage start

2. STAKEHOLDERS & RESPONSIBILITIES

Customer Team (Summerset)
- Mason Beasley
  - Role: Primary administrator and main point of contact
  - Responsibilities: Account setup, bank connection, employee invitation management, coordinating between locations
  - Email: mbeasley@summerset (with +MC and +ALMC variations for separate accounts)

- Summerset Inga
  - Role: Business Office Manager (BOM) for Assisted Living location
  - Responsibilities: Employee verification, admin access for AL location, employee support
  - Status: Added as administrator for AL account

- Anna/Shauna Pierce
  - Role: Business Office Manager for Memory Care location
  - Responsibilities: Employee roster verification, admin access for MC location, employee support
  - Status: Added as administrator for MC account, confirmed employee roster accuracy

External Partners
- Jessica Reyes (HuB Insurance)
  - Role: Broker contact for dental/vision benefits
  - Status: Caroline sent follow-up email requesting 2026 dental/vision information
  - Note: Has been unresponsive to Inga's previous emails

Thatch Team
- Caroline Clark
  - Role: Implementation specialist/account manager
  - Responsibilities: Platform training, troubleshooting, coordinating broker appointments, ongoing support

3. CRITICAL MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

December 15, 2025 (Call Date):
- Mason completed Memory Care employer profile setup
- Bank account successfully connected for MC location
- Admin access granted to Shauna Pierce for MC account
- Began setup process for AL/ALNC account during call
- Identified employee roster discrepancies requiring correction before invitation

Key Technical Issues Resolved:
- Initial confusion about separate accounts for each location
- Password/login management for multiple accounts (resolved using email+modifier format)
- ADP integration issues - decided to proceed without integration temporarily to avoid delays

December 22, 2025 - CRITICAL DEADLINE:
- Last day for employees to select plans to ensure January 1, 2026 coverage start date
- Any enrollments after this date will result in delayed coverage

January 1, 2026:
- Target effective date for all employee medical coverage through Thatch

4. NEXT STEPS & ACTION ITEMS

Immediate Actions (Mason - By End of Day December 15, 2025)
- [ ] Complete AL/ALNC account setup (estimated 10 minutes)
- [ ] Add Inga as administrator for AL account
- [ ] Review and correct employee roster discrepancies using three-dot edit function
- [ ] Verify full-time vs. part-time status for all employees before sending invitations
- [ ] Send employee invitations for both MC and AL locations

Employee Communication (Shauna/Inga - Week of December 15, 2025)
- [ ] Utilize welcome email templates from Resources tab in admin portal
- [ ] Send open enrollment kickoff communication to employees
- [ ] Emphasize December 22nd deadline in all communications
- [ ] Direct employees to schedule broker appointments for plan selection assistance
- [ ] Provide support for Spanish-speaking employees (Spanish-speaking brokers available)

Ongoing Administrative Tasks
- [ ] Monitor employee enrollment progress through admin dashboard
- [ ] Update employee status changes (full-time/part-time transitions) using three-dot edit function
- [ ] Process terminations using "off-board" button (triggers COBRA handling automatically)
- [ ] Coordinate with Jessica Reyes at HuB for dental/vision enrollment through EASE platform

Technical Follow-Up (Post-Enrollment)
- [ ] Schedule call with Thatch technical team to resolve ADP integration issues
- [ ] Connect ADP account through admin portal once integration issues resolved
- [ ] Reduce dual-system administration burden (currently managing ADP, EASE, and Thatch separately)

IMPORTANT NOTES & CONSIDERATIONS

Employee Support Resources
- Broker Appointments: Employees can self-schedule same-day appointments via "Need help and support" button in their account
- Spanish Language Support: Available through Spanish-speaking brokers
- Plan Selection: 28+ medical plan options available (varies by employee location/zip code)
- Mobile Access: Platform accessible via phone but computer recommended for better experience
- Resources Tab: Contains employer handbook, FAQs, communication templates, and employee-facing materials

Administrative Challenges Identified
- Multiple Systems: Team managing three separate platforms (ADP, EASE, Thatch) for benefits administration
- Employee Demographics: Diverse workforce with multiple cultures and languages requiring multilingual support
- Communication Preferences: Some employees prefer paper documentation to review with family members (not available due to extensive plan options)
- Technical Literacy: Varying comfort levels with technology among employee population

Outstanding Issues
- EASE Platform: Employees receiving premature benefit cards before enrollment completion
- Dental/Vision Information: Awaiting 2026 details from Jessica Reyes at HuB
- ADP Integration: Temporarily bypassed; needs resolution post-enrollment
- Kaiser Availability: Uncertainty about Kaiser options in Nevada market (Renown/Kaiser merger discussions ongoing)

RISK MITIGATION

Timeline Risk: With only 7 days until enrollment deadline (December 22, 2025), immediate employee invitation is critical to prevent coverage gaps.

Communication Risk: Multilingual workforce requires proactive outreach and broker appointment scheduling to ensure all employees understand options and complete enrollment.

Technical Risk: Managing three separate systems increases administrative burden and potential for errors; ADP integration should be prioritized after initial enrollment period.

Next Account Review: Post-December 22, 2025 to assess enrollment completion rates and address any outstanding issues.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__ed.title: Current Benefit Process
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__ed.value:
The prospect currently administers employee benefits using multiple platforms and services:

Benefits Administration Platforms:
- Ease: Used for dental and vision benefits administration. Employees access Ease to enroll in these benefits, and the platform sends communications about benefits enrollment.
- ADP: Used for payroll and employee status management. When employees change status (e.g., full-time to part-time), the changes are made in ADP.

Broker/Third-Party Service:
- HuB: The prospect works with HuB as their broker, with Jessica Reyes and Jason as their primary contacts for benefits-related matters, particularly for dental and vision benefits.

Workflow and Responsibilities:
- Office managers (Inga for one building, Shauna/Anna for another) are responsible for benefits administration at their respective locations
- They manage employee enrollments and field benefits questions from employees throughout the day
- They previously provided paper copies of benefit information to employees who wanted to take materials home to discuss with family
- They use census spreadsheets to track employee information and eligibility
- They manually manage terminations and new hires across multiple systems (ADP, Ease, and now Thatch)

The prospect is transitioning to add Thatch for medical benefits while maintaining Ease for dental and vision, which will require them to manage benefits across multiple platforms.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.title: Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.value:
Date: 2025-12-12

Prospect 1: Brown Construction Services
- Current Situation: Implementation of payroll deductions is ongoing. Reports received were encrypted, causing access issues.
- Pain Points/Challenges: Difficulty accessing encrypted reports. Need to update payroll sync with accurate deduction numbers.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Ensure accurate payroll deductions and report access. Update payroll sync with YTD task numbers.
- Stated Timelines: Upcoming payroll deduction report on 2025-12-12 will have higher deductions to catch up from previous missed deductions.

Prospect 2: Stellar IT Solutions, LLC
- Current Situation: Operates multiple entities, including Stellar IT Solutions LLC and Staffing Resources LLC. Staffing Resources LLC has coverage through Allied, with Paychex as the broker of record. Census was sent but unable to unlock for review.
- Pain Points/Challenges: Coordination of meetings and follow-up calls due to scheduling difficulties. Technical issues with census access. Concern about employee participation rates if subsidies aren't competitive.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Switch both applicable entities to Thatch. Interested in medical and vision coverage options. Consolidate coverage through Thatch for multiple entities. Provide dental and vision quotes.
- Stated Timelines: Originally discussed effective date of 2026-01-01, but timing may be too tight. Alternative options include 2026-02-01 or later effective date. Next steps meeting scheduled for 2025-12-12 with Joseph Firenzi.

Prospect 3: Mack Barber
- Current Situation: Only 8 of 25 employees enrolled in benefits. Mack's personal enrollment completed. Three Canadian W-2 interns on staff through April 2026.
- Pain Points/Challenges: Enrollment deadline confusion, low enrollment rate, technical issue with employee access, ID verification barrier for Canadian intern, unclear enrollment status for other interns.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Establish clear enrollment deadline, resolve technical barriers, complete enrollment for all employees.
- Stated Timelines: Target deadline: 2025-12-18 (Mack's preference for communication). Possible extension to 2025-12-26.

Prospect 4: Lucky's Coffee Garage (LLC)
- Current Situation: First-time ICRA implementation. Young employee demographic (ideal for ICRA). Payroll system ready for integration (Paychecks).
- Pain Points/Challenges: First ICRA setup experience for broker (Keegan). Tight year-end timeline. Need to coordinate during ownership transition. Potential payroll eligibility discrepancies to address.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Implement ICRA for 2026 plan year. $200/month employer contribution per employee. Medical coverage only (dental/vision handled separately through Paychecks). Quick setup completion.
- Stated Timelines: Coverage effective date: 2026-01-01. Employee enrollment deadline: 2025-12-19 or 2025-12-26. Employer account setup: ASAP (ideally same day - 2025-12-12). Late enrollments (if missed deadline): Effective 2026-02-01. Platform improvements expected: End of Q1 2026.

Meeting with Ty (Washington D.C. Client)
- **Current

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
Account Notes: Comprehensive Summary of ICHRA Discussions

1. Key Points Discussed:

- Employer Interest in ICHRA: Multiple employers, including Tatch, Lucky's Coffee Garage, Home Works for Books LLC, and others, expressed interest in ICHRA to manage 2026 renewal costs and reduce administrative workload. The primary drivers include cost control through defined contributions, flexibility in plan selection, and reducing the burden of managing traditional group plans.

- Cost Management: Employers are exploring ICHRA as a means to stabilize long-term costs, with individual marketplace plans showing lower annual increases compared to group plans. Employers are considering various contribution models, including flat-rate and age-banded allowances, to align with budget constraints.

- Administrative Benefits: The ICHRA model allows employers to shift plan selection to employees, reducing decision-making burdens. Employers can offer a wide range of plans through platforms like Thatch, providing employees with choice and flexibility.

2. Identification of Stakeholders:

- Employers: Key decision-makers include Conley McIntyre (Eggs 8), Debra (Lucky's Coffee Garage), Julie/Julia (Home Works for Books LLC), and Jason (Quad Ent.). These individuals are responsible for final decisions on ICHRA implementation and budget allocation.

- Paychex Representatives: Ashley DeBellis, Keegan A., Tiffany Thorton, and others serve as primary contacts, facilitating communication between clients and Thatch, and supporting the enrollment process.

- Thatch Representatives: Isra Ahmed, Ty Phillippay, Denis Kalamar, and Andrew Solomon provide ICHRA expertise, compliance guidance, and technical support for implementation.

3. Important Milestones and Timestamps:

- December 1, 2025: Eggs 8 renewed with the current carrier, setting the stage for ICHRA discussions.

- December 11-15, 2025: Multiple meetings and communications took place, including discussions with Lucky's Coffee Garage, Home Works for Books LLC, and others, focusing on ICHRA setup and compliance issues.

- December 15, 2025: Critical meetings occurred, including discussions with Quad Ent. and Pool Designs by Poolside LLC, addressing urgent enrollment deadlines and compliance challenges.

4. Next Steps with Deadlines and Responsible Parties:

- Immediate Actions: Employers need to confirm business tax structures, finalize contribution models, and complete employer account setups. Responsible parties include Paychex representatives and Thatch specialists.

- Enrollment Deadlines: For a January 1, 2026 start date, employee enrollment must be completed by December 22, 2025. Employers and Thatch representatives must ensure timely communication and support to meet this deadline.

- Compliance and Technical Setup: Thatch representatives will address compliance issues, such as S-Corp owner participation, and ensure technical setup for payroll integration and employee enrollment.

By focusing on these key areas, the synthesized account notes provide a comprehensive overview of the ICHRA discussions, stakeholders involved, critical milestones, and next steps required to achieve successful implementation.

- Stated Timelines: Upcoming payroll deduction report on 2025-12-12 will have higher deductions to catch up from previous missed deductions.

Prospect 2: Stellar IT Solutions, LLC
- Current Situation: Operates multiple entities, including Stellar IT Solutions LLC and Staffing Resources LLC. Staffing Resources LLC has coverage through Allied, with Paychex as the broker of record. Census was sent but unable to unlock for review.
- Pain Points/Challenges: Coordination of meetings and follow-up calls due to scheduling difficulties. Technical issues with census access. Concern about employee participation rates if subsidies aren't competitive.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Switch both applicable entities to Thatch. Interested in medical and vision coverage options. Consolidate coverage through Thatch for multiple entities. Provide dental and vision quotes.
- Stated Timelines: Originally discussed effective date of 2026-01-01, but timing may be too tight. Alternative options include 2026-02-01 or later effective date. Next steps meeting scheduled for 2025-12-12 with Joseph Firenzi.

Prospect 3: Mack Barber
- Current Situation: Only 8 of 25 employees enrolled in benefits. Mack's personal enrollment completed. Three Canadian W-2 interns on staff through April 2026.
- Pain Points/Challenges: Enrollment deadline confusion, low enrollment rate, technical issue with employee access, ID verification barrier for Canadian intern, unclear enrollment status for other interns.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Establish clear enrollment deadline, resolve technical barriers, complete enrollment for all employees.
- Stated Timelines: Target deadline: 2025-12-18 (Mack's preference for communication). Possible extension to 2025-12-26.

Prospect 4: Lucky's Coffee Garage (LLC)
- Current Situation: First-time ICRA implementation. Young employee demographic (ideal for ICRA). Payroll system ready for integration (Paychecks).
- Pain Points/Challenges: First ICRA setup experience for broker (Keegan). Tight year-end timeline. Need to coordinate during ownership transition. Potential payroll eligibility discrepancies to address.
- Priorities/Optimization Goals: Implement ICRA for 2026 plan year. $200/month employer contribution per employee. Medical coverage only (dental/vision handled separately through Paychecks). Quick setup completion.
- Stated Timelines: Coverage effective date: 2026-01-01. Employee enrollment deadline: 2025-12-19 or 2025-12-26. Employer account setup: ASAP (ideally same day - 2025-12-12). Late enrollments (if missed deadline): Effective 2026-02-01. Platform improvements expected: End of Q1 2026.

Meeting with Ty (Washington D.C. Client)
- **Current

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__ed.title: Current Benefit Process
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__ed.value:
The prospects have diverse methods of administering employee benefits:

1. Eggs 8 and Tripathy Learning: Both use Paychex, Inc. as their broker and third-party benefits administrator. Eggs 8 has a detailed workflow involving Paychex's platform for managing contribution levels, class codes, and employee enrollment information. They also have class-based administration with different contribution levels for managers and employees.

2. Mack Barber: Is in the process of transitioning to or using an online benefits enrollment platform, though the specific platform is not named. The workflow includes sending email notifications to employees and utilizing support services for enrollment issues.

3. Home Works for Books LLC: Previously relied on a PEO but now works with a broker to find alternative benefits solutions. There is no mention of a specific benefits administration platform or manual process.

4. Stellar IT Solutions, LLC: Relies on a broker or third-party service, specifically Paychex, for benefits administration. No specific platform or manual process is mentioned.

5. Pool Designs by Poolside LLC: Does not have a formal benefits administration system and is exploring setting up benefits for the first time, considering an ICHRA solution.

6. Quad Ent.: Uses Paychex for payroll but does not currently administer employee health benefits. They are looking to implement an ICHRA to begin offering health benefits.

7. Flock (referred to as CLOC): Used by a prospect for benefits administration, but medical benefits are administered through DC HealthLink. The prospect works with a broker for benefits support.

Overall, the prospects use a mix of brokers, third-party services, and are exploring new platforms or solutions for benefits administration. Some rely on Paychex for both payroll and benefits administration, while others are in transition or setting up benefits for the first time.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.title: Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__b0.value:
Meeting Date: 2025-12-15

Current Situation:
- Small employer (non-ALE, under 50 employees) currently with IOA insurance
- Paying ~$5,200/month total for employee health coverage
- Covering 100% of employee-only premiums; employees pay for dependent coverage
- Current plans: Truly plan ($3,500 individual/$7,000 family deductible) and Blue Care Silver 25 (zero deductible)
- 100% enrollment among eligible employees
- Business partners on Medicare (excluded from count)

Priorities:
- Maintain current quality of coverage
- Keep monthly costs at or below $5,200
- Explore potential cost savings without sacrificing benefits

Pain Points/Challenges:
- Rising healthcare costs
- Recent agent of record (AOR) change causing administrative access issues
- Uncertainty about upcoming renewal rates
- Two employees (Nicole and Carol) need immediate attention due to qualifying events/coverage loss by 2025-12-31

Optimization Goals:
- Find comparable coverage at lower cost if possible
- Maintain generous 100% employee premium contribution
- Ensure compliance and smooth administration

Stated Timelines:
- Immediate: Address Nicole and Carol's coverage needs by 2025-12-31
- May 2026: Current plan renewal date
- Decision Point: Will revisit Thatch option after seeing May 2026 renewal rates

Outcome:
Thatch quote showed $6,000-$7,000 employer contribution for comparable coverage (higher than current cost). Client will maintain current IOA plan and reconsider Thatch if May 2026 renewal shows significant rate increases.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__da.title: Next Steps
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__da.value:
12/15/2025

Prospect Actions (Tim Jamco/Jamco Company):
- Review the Thatch quote and compare coverage/costs with current IOA plan
- Monitor current plan renewal in May 2026 for potential rate increases
- Reconnect with Thatch/Brittany if May 2026 renewal rates are unfavorable
- Deadline: May 2026 (renewal date)

Rep Actions (Brittany/Thatch):
- Resend the quote link to Tim Jamco's email
- Remain available for follow-up if renewal rates increase
- Deadline: Immediate (resend quote)

IOA Actions (Cynthia Story):
- Speak with employee Nicole regarding qualifying event (losing coverage, needs enrollment by 12/31/2025)
- Speak with employee Carol regarding personal coverage questions
- Work to restore AOR (Agent of Record) status to regain system access
- Deadline: 12/31/2025 (for Nicole's enrollment)

Overall Deal Status:
The prospect is staying with their current IOA plan ($5,200/month) through May 2026 renewal. Thatch could not beat the current pricing for comparable coverage. The deal will remain dormant until May 2026 renewal, at which point the prospect will reassess if rates increase significantly. No formal follow-up meeting scheduled; prospect will initiate contact if needed after renewal.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
Account Notes - Thatch ICHRA Quote Discussion
Date: Monday, December 15, 2025  
Account: Jamco (employer)

1. KEY POINTS DISCUSSED

Employer's Interest in ICHRA
- Primary Objective: Explore cost reduction opportunities while maintaining comparable coverage to current group health plan
- Current Situation: 
  - Monthly spend: ~$5,200 with IOA's Truly plan
  - Employer contributes 100% of employee-only premiums
  - No dependent coverage contribution (employees pay dependent costs)
  - Current plans: Truly plan ($3,500 individual deductible, $7,000 family) and Blue Care Silver 25 (zero deductible)
  - 100% enrollment among eligible employees
  - Business partners on Medicare (excluded from count)

ICHRA Solution Analysis
- Employer Classification: Non-applicable large employer (under 50 employees), therefore not bound by strict affordability requirements
- Thatch Quote Results:
  - Base employer contribution: $6,000/month
  - Total cost with Thatch fees: $7,000/month
  - All employees would receive affordable allowances based on age, ZIP code, and salary
  - 181 plans available for members (example: Anthony)
  - Plans comparable to current coverage available

Cost-Benefit Analysis
- Conclusion: Thatch ICHRA solution would be $1,800-$2,000 more expensive monthly than current plan for similar coverage
- Employer Decision: Continue with existing IOA plan through current term
- Rationale: Current plan provides good value; healthcare costs have increased industry-wide

Administrative Benefits Discussed
- Compliance management (1094, 1095, Schedule A, PCRI, ACA reporting, COBRA)
- Guaranteed no dropped enrollments
- Integrated enrollment platform with advisor support
- Payroll integration capabilities
- Portal access for employer and broker (IOA)
- Rate stability (individual market typically sees lower increases than group market)

2. STAKEHOLDERS IDENTIFIED

Prospect Company (Jamco)
- Tim Jamco - Decision maker, business owner
  - Role: Primary contact, final authority on benefits decisions
  - Responsibilities: Evaluating cost-effectiveness, maintaining employee benefits

Current Broker
- Cynthia Story (IOA) - Current broker/agent
  - Role: Benefits advisor, plan administrator
  - Responsibilities: Managing current group plan, providing plan details, supporting evaluation process
  - Note: Temporarily lost AOR status but working to restore access

Thatch Team
- Brittany - Sales representative (based in Southern California)
  - Role: Primary presenter, ICHRA solution consultant
  - Responsibilities: Quote presentation, plan comparison, explaining ICHRA mechanics
  
- Monica Hirschheimer - Thatch team member (supporting role)
  - Role: Sales support, typically leads these conversations
  - Responsibilities: Technical support, quote sharing
  - Note: Monica is NOT the prospect/customer and does NOT work at the prospect's company

Employees Mentioned
- Greg - Age 58, most expensive employee due to age-based rating
- Anthony - Age 36, one dependent
- Nicole - Experiencing qualifying event (losing coverage), needs to enroll by December 31, 2025
- Carol - Similar situation to Nicole, has questions before making decision
- Matt - Referenced in conversation, previously on ObamaCare platform

3. IMPORTANT MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

Critical Dates
- December 31, 2025 - Deadline for Nicole and Carol to select new plans (losing coverage from previous platform)
- May 2026 - Current group plan renewal date with IOA
- 2026 - Thatch costs quoted reflect 2026 rates

Key Conversation Moments
1. Opening Discussion - Identified that some employees (Nicole, Carol) are transitioning from ObamaCare platform and need immediate assistance
2. AOR Issue Identified - Cynthia Story noted loss of Agent of Record status, limiting her access to print cards and view enrollments
3. Quote Review - Brittany walked through Thatch platform, explaining affordability calculations and plan options
4. Cost Comparison - Revealed Thatch solution would be approximately $1,800-$2,000 more expensive monthly
5. Decision Point - Tim Jamco decided to maintain current plan but remain open to future evaluation
6. Positive Rate Story - Brittany shared personal experience of $300/month premium decrease with Blue Shield of California (rare positive outcome)

4. NEXT STEPS WITH DEADLINES

Immediate Actions (By December 31, 2025)
- Responsible Party: Cynthia Story (IOA)
- Action Items:
  - Process Nicole's enrollment (qualifying event - loss of coverage)
  - Connect with Carol to answer questions and process her enrollment
  - Resolve AOR status to regain system access
  - May need to manually push enrollments through due to access limitations

Short-Term Follow-Up
- Responsible Party: Brittany (Thatch)
- Action Items:
  - Resend quote link to Tim Jamco for future reference
  - Remain available for questions as employer reviews options

Future Evaluation (April-May 2026)
- Responsible Party: Tim Jamco with support from Cynthia Story (IOA)
- Action Items:
  - Review renewal rates from current carrier in May 2026
  - If renewal increase is unfavorable, reconnect with Thatch to re-evaluate ICHRA option
  - Compare renewed group plan costs against Thatch ICHRA solution

Ongoing Monitoring
- Responsible Party: All parties
- Action Items:
  - Tim Jamco: Monitor employee satisfaction with current plan
  - Cynthia Story: Provide renewal information well in advance of May 2026 deadline
  - Brittany/Thatch: Stay in touch, be prepared to provide updated quotes if requested

ADDITIONAL NOTES

Employer Preferences
- Values generous benefits (currently covering 100% of employee premiums)
- Prioritizes cost management without sacrificing coverage quality
- Open to exploring alternatives but conservative in decision-making
- Appreciates having options available for future consideration

Technical Details
- Payroll handled through CPA (not integrated with standard payroll providers)
- Thatch can accommodate non-integrated payroll systems
- Employer would need payroll integration setup if moving to ICHRA

Market Context
- Florida market generally favorable for ICHRA with low rate increases
- Individual market typically more stable than group market for rate increases
- Current group plan pricing is competitive for the coverage provided

Relationship Status
- Current Status: Prospect declined immediate move to ICHRA
- Future Opportunity: High probability of re-engagement if May 2026 renewal is unfavorable
- Relationship Quality: Positive, professional interaction; door remains open

attributes.title: Thatch Jamco Quote Discussion
attributes.transcript:
Cynthia Story:
I think we're just waiting on Brittany. 
Tim Jamco:
How's it going? I was just talking to Matt on the other line there. 
Cynthia Story:
Yeah. Did he tell you about the one employee? 
Tim Jamco:
Yes. So there's another one that's Carol that needs to speak to you as well. 
Cynthia Story:
Okay. Is she coming up to her eligibility? 
Tim Jamco:
Well, these are all people that were on the other guys. He had them through the ObamaCare platform. 
Cynthia Story:
Okay. So they're losing coverage. 
Tim Jamco:
Yeah, they're making a decision. Well, I guess you have to, right? You have to make a plan by the 31st. And I don't know about that guy. I'd rather just work with IOA. No headaches. 
Cynthia Story:
Well, so it's a qualifying event, basically for Nicole, is what I'm understanding. She's losing her coverage. 
Tim Jamco:
Correct. And Carol will be the same. But I think Carol just has a few personal questions she wants to ask you first before she makes the final decision. 
Cynthia Story:
Okay, she can do that. Okay. Again, I'm going to try to push it through, but we're not showing that we're the agent anymore. So they may not work with us. I don't know. So that kind of, I have no access to anything where before I could, like, print cards off, I could see who's enrolled. I have no access any longer. So then the AOR new agent has that. 
Tim Jamco:
So we'll switch that back then, right? 
Cynthia Story:
Perfect. 
Tim Jamco:
Okay. 
Cynthia Story:
Cause we'll do, even if it, it might require us to push her through it, you know, one, one, because we don't have access, but I will get it going and. 
Tim Jamco:
Okay. 
Cynthia Story:
But okay. Hi, Brittany. How are you? 
Brittany:
How are you guys? 
Tim Jamco:
Good. Good. 
Cynthia Story:
Doing well. 
Brittany:
All right. So we want to, we want to jump in here. So let's do that. My name is Brittany. I live in Socal. And well, we'll get you, we're going to pull up your quote here, because that's the name of the game today. Happy holidays, by the way. Okay. 
Cynthia Story:
Thank you. 
Brittany:
So here we go. I believe this has already been shared. It might not be, it's, it's, igra is new for a lot of people. There's a lot of moving parts, they're not quite fully on board with everything that's that. Uh, hi, Monica, and maybe Monica even wants to share the quote. 
Monica Hirschheimer (Thatch):
But um, go for it. 
Brittany:
There's a lot, there's a lot of details to be aware of. Okay, and now you can hopefully see the quote, so I believe there's a number. Um, if you have, you have you pulled up the quote previously? Have you looked at this before? 
Tim Jamco:
I have not. 
Brittany:

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.title: Account Notes
fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__51.value:
ACCOUNT NOTES - Rocco / Thatch Introduction Call

Date: Monday, December 15, 2025  
Thatch Representative: Retsy Holliday  
Prospect: Rocco (Owner)  
Company: High-end custom home construction company (Chicago area, also works in Wisconsin, Florida, California)

1. KEY POINTS DISCUSSED - EMPLOYER'S INTEREST IN ICHRA

Current Situation & Pain Points:
- Company Size: 8-10 employees
- Current Coverage: Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO
- Annual Premium Increases: 17% minimum year-over-year
- Primary Motivations:
  - Manage escalating 2026 renewal costs (noted that 2026 has been worst year for health insurance with increases ranging 75-85% industry-wide)
  - Reduce administrative burden of managing group plan
  - Attract and retain quality employees through competitive benefits
  - Obtain more reasonable health insurance for owner's family

Personal Health Considerations:
- Critical Factor: Rocco's wife and 3 of 4 children have genetic heart condition
- Specialized Care: Family visits Mayo Clinic every other year
- Coverage Requirements: Must ensure specific providers remain in-network
- Success Story: Condition is known and controlled, but requires careful plan selection

ICHRA Solution Interest:
- Budget Control: Employer defines budget rather than insurance policy (eliminates annual renewal uncertainty)
- Risk Pooling: Individual plans spread risk across 25 million people vs. small group
- Employee Choice: 4-5 carriers, ~20 plan options per employee based on age/zip code
- Tax Advantages: Pre-tax allowances (vs. post-tax on healthcare.gov)
- Surplus Funds: Unused allowance can be spent on qualified medical expenses or marketplace (functions like FSA, rolls month-to-month, reverts to employer at year-end)
- Administrative Relief: Thatch handles enrollments, payments, ACA reporting (1094/1095), COBRA administration

Key Benefits Identified:
1. Employer no longer picks the plan - just sets dollar amount
2. Employees select plans matching their individual needs
3. Broader risk pool provides stability and choice
4. Dynamic pricing ensures purchasing power equity across employees
5. Marketplace access for additional benefits (mental health, gym, GLP-1s, etc.)

2. STAKEHOLDERS IDENTIFIED

Primary Stakeholders:

Rocco (Owner/Decision Maker)
- Role: Company owner, final decision authority
- Responsibilities: Review quote, confirm corporate structure eligibility, approve implementation
- Concerns: Family health coverage continuity, Mayo Clinic provider network access
- Note: May be ineligible to participate if LLC/S-Corp with pass-through taxation and >2% ownership

Jackie (Office Manager/Bookkeeper)
- Role: Administrative point of contact
- Responsibilities: Provide census data, SBCS documentation, coordinate with Retsy
- Note: Manages current health care administration (possibly through Legacy Management S-Corp)

Retsy Holliday (Thatch Account Executive)
- Role: Sales representative, solution consultant
- Responsibilities: Build quote, analyze cost comparison, provide S-Corp eligibility documentation, coordinate implementation
- Turnaround: 24-hour quote generation after receiving data

Secondary Stakeholders:

Rocco's Attorney
- Role: Legal advisor
- Responsibilities: Confirm corporate structure and owner eligibility for ICHRA participation
- Note: Set up "convoluted" corporate structure with ownership through another corporation

Thatch Concierge Team
- Role: Licensed advisors for employee support
- Responsibilities: Same-day/24-hour consultations for plan selection assistance
- Availability: For all employees needing personalized guidance

Employees (8-10 total)
- Role: Benefit recipients
- Responsibilities: Select individual plans through Thatch platform
- Support: AI chatbot, concierge advisors, provider search tools

3. IMPORTANT MILESTONES & TIMESTAMPS

Call Duration: Approximately 18 minutes (12 minutes returned to prospect)

Critical Moments:

1. Opening (0:00-2:00): Agenda setting and current situation assessment
   - Rocco disclosed 17% annual increases and family health condition

2. Solution Presentation (2:00-12:00): Core ICHRA education
   - Mission and fintech-first approach explained
   - Budget vs. policy definition concept introduced
   - Employee shopping experience and support mechanisms detailed
   - Marketplace benefits showcased

3. Administrative Overview (12:00-14:00): End-to-end compliance discussion
   - Enrollment, payment, ACA reporting, COBRA handling

4. Critical Disclosure (14:00-16:00): S-Corp/LLC ownership eligibility issue
   - KEY MILESTONE: Rocco revealed complex corporate structure
   - Potential owner ineligibility identified as major consideration
   - Mayo Clinic provider network requirement flagged

5. Next Steps Agreement (16:00-18:00): Action items established
   - Census data and SBCS request confirmed
   - Attorney consultation on corporate structure agreed
   - Provider network verification process outlined

4. NEXT STEPS - DEADLINES & RESPONSIBLE PARTIES

Immediate Actions (Within 24-48 Hours):

Action 1: Send Follow-Up Email
- Responsible: Retsy Holliday
- Deadline: Within minutes of call completion (2025-12-15)
- Deliverables:
  - Census data template
  - SBCS (Summary of Benefits and Coverage) request
  - S-Corp/LLC eligibility documentation
  - Call summary and next steps

Action 2: Provide Census Data & SBCS
- Responsible: Jackie (Office Manager/Bookkeeper)
- Deadline: ASAP (to enable 24-hour quote turnaround)
- Deliverables:
  - Employee census (age, zip code, current coverage details)
  - Current SBCS showing plan deductibles and out-of-pocket costs
  - Clarification on whether coverage runs through Legacy Management (S-Corp)

Action 3: Confirm Corporate Structure
- Responsible: Rocco (via attorney)
- Deadline: Concurrent with census data submission
- Deliverables:
  - Confirmation of LLC/S-Corp status
  - Tax filing method (pass-through vs. C-Corp election)
  - Owner eligibility determination for ICHRA participation

Secondary Actions (24-72 Hours):

Action 4: Generate Quote
- Responsible: Retsy Holliday
- Deadline: 24 hours after receiving census data
- Deliverables:
  - Cost comparison: current spend vs. ICHRA allowance model
  - Plan matching comparable to current PPO benefits
  - Analysis of owner participation scenarios (if applicable)

Action 5: Provider Network Verification
- Responsible: Retsy Holliday (if Rocco eligible to participate)
- Deadline: During quote review phase
- Deliverables:
  - Confirmation of Mayo Clinic provider in-network status
  - Plan options ensuring family's specialized care continuity

Follow-Up Actions (Post-Quote):

Action 6: Quote Review Meeting
- Responsible: Retsy Holliday & Rocco (+ Jackie if needed)
- Deadline: TBD after quote delivery
- Objectives:
  - Review cost savings analysis
  - Address owner eligibility implications
  - Confirm Mayo Clinic coverage
  - Decision on moving forward

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

Rapport Building:
- Rocco appreciated fast-paced communication style
- Positive connection established over home improvement interest
- Italian heritage (born in Italy)

Risk Factors:
- Owner eligibility uncertainty could be deal-breaker
- Family health condition requires careful provider network validation
- Complex corporate structure may require additional legal review

Opportunity Indicators:
- Strong pain point (17% annual increases)
- Motivated by employee attraction/retention
- Open to innovative solutions
- Quick decision-making style indicated

Quote Requirements:
- Must match or exceed current PPO benefit level
- Must demonstrate cost savings for both employer and employees
- Must ensure Mayo Clinic provider access for owner's family
- Should include analysis of owner participation vs. exchange options

Call Outcome: Positive introduction with clear next steps established. Awaiting census data and corporate structure confirmation to proceed with quote generation.

fed6e1f8-fc50-4dcf-bff7-494a231ae9f3__ed.value: The prospect's benefits administration is handled by their office manager and bookkeeper, Jackie. Rocco mentioned that Jackie "runs the health care" but he was uncertain about the specific details, stating "I don't know who she runs the health care through." He mentioned "legacy Management" as a possibility, which he thinks might be an S-Corp, but expressed uncertainty about this as well. No specific benefits administration platform (such as Ease, Rippling, or Zenefits) was mentioned, nor were any details provided about manual processes, workflows, or tools used. Rocco indicated he would need to have Jackie provide the census data and other information, suggesting she manages the administrative details of their employee benefits.

text_plain_content.title: Generated Email
text_plain_content.value:
Hi Rocco,


It was great speaking with you today! Coming out of our conversation, here's a quick recap of where you are today and the goals we aligned on:


Your Current State


Currently on Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO with annual premium increases of 17% (minimally)


Managing health benefits for 8-10 employees in your high-end home construction business


Need to ensure coverage for your family's genetic heart condition, including Mayo Clinic visits every other year


Goals


Secure more reasonable and predictable health insurance costs for your family and employees


Attract and retain quality employees by offering competitive benefit plans


Eliminate the burden of annual double-digit premium increases while maintaining necessary coverage (especially Mayo Clinic network access)


Next Steps


You'll have Jackie send over census data and your current Summary of Benefits (SBCS) - I've attached the Thatch analysis template for you to use.


Jackie should also confirm your corporate structure (LLC/S-Corp/C-Corp filing status) to determine owner eligibility - feel free to loop in your attorney if needed.


I'll prepare a detailed cost analysis and quote within 24 hours of receiving the data, including verification of Mayo Clinic network coverage, then share my calendar to review together.


Resources


Thatch/ICHRA Overview — a helpful summary of who we are and how we work


S-Corp/LLC Owner Eligibility Documentation — to help clarify participation requirements


You can reach me anytime at (571) 234-7147. 


Looking forward to our next conversation!


Cheers,

Retsy

items.description: • Successfully discovered carrier and plan type: Asked "what plan are you guys on today?" and confirmed "Blue Cross, Blue Shield PPO"
items.title: Understand Current Plan Structure

items.description: • Strong discovery: Rocco clearly stated "every year it goes up 17% minimally" and needs better benefits to "attract good employees."
items.title: Identify Pain

items.description: • Successfully captured team size when Rocco mentioned "between eight and ten employees" during initial discovery
items.title: Capture Team & Enrollment Size

items.description: • Successfully identified prioritized goals: Rocco specified 17% annual increases, talent attraction needs, and critical family health coverage requirements.
items.title: Identify Impact & Priorities

items.description:
• Improvement focus – Uncover specific timing and decision deadlines
• Conversation reference – When Rocco mentioned 17% annual increases, should have asked about renewal dates
• Action item – Ask "When does your current plan renew?"
items.title: Timeline or Decision Deadline Shared

items.description:
• Improvement focus – Map complete decision-making process and stakeholders
• Conversation reference – When Rocco mentioned Jackie handles healthcare and complex corporate structure
• Action item – Ask about approval process and stakeholder roles
items.title: Decision Process Mapped

summary.summaryText:
- The salesperson identified pain points well; Rocco mentioned 17% annual increases and talent attraction needs.
- The salesperson missed asking about renewal dates; next, ask "When does your current plan renew?" to uncover timing.
- The salesperson didn't map the decision process; next, inquire about approval steps and stakeholder roles for clarity.
